course.subject: LABU
course.name: Business Case Analyses
course.description: This course seeks to equip students with persuasive communication skills, both oral and written, through analyzing business cases and presenting solutions to problems identified. It provides students with a solid framework and hands-on practice to communicate persuasively and professionally in business settings. In presenting the case problem, analysis and recommendations, students learn to identify issues, develop and organize key ideas, and eventually to persuade the audience of the validity of the arguments and proposed actions. The course sharpens students' ability to explain and support ideas logically, coherently and cohesively using various techniques, to communicate clearly, concisely and accurately, and in appropriate tone and style. Through a range of learning activities involving reading, discussion, writing and making oral presentations, students also develop critical reading, critical thinking and problem solving skills as well as teamwork and leadership skills. For students who have this course as a program requirement.
course.prerequisites: CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1003 (prior to 2022-23)
course.exclusions: LABU 2051, LABU 2052

reviews.author: tungcc
reviews.title: I hate Labu!
reviews.comment_content:
To be honest, I am not the kind of person who loves to type bad words, but because of her, I cannot tolerate.
You learn nothing after the labu classes. All you know is to work hard for your tasks to get a bad grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: I hate her to be (very) honest. Don’t think she is a nice tutor, she isn’t!!!!!!! The only words I can use to describe her is 笑裡藏刀! She is so bossy and she has many requirements from you. But at the end you will never know what she requires from her deeper heart
reviews.comment_grading: Absolutely bad grading. I have got VG. COMPETENT SATISFACTORY over all my tasks but in the end I got a C grade. I cannot control myself speaking foul language when I see the grade. What makes it worst is that you pay a lot of effort in doing the tasks and attending the lessons, but it ends up a C range.  I believe other tutors have much better grades than her.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course has heavy workload. You have to do two orals and one report. I am sure if you are in Gloria’s class you get extra workload. She loves to give hw each lesson.
So far, I have received many feedbacks from others saying Gloria gives bad grade. I don’t know how she graded in the past, but to those who are reading this, you are lucky as she will leave UST after 2020 fall, meaning you will never meet her in the next semester.

reviews.author: little potatoo
reviews.comment_content:

the second project please don't freeride because there is peer evaluation and it costs 5% of total course grade!!!!!!!

reviews.comment_teaching: He is very nice and funny, but is he so strict that for presentation, if you don't walk around or don't make interactions with audience, you will definitely get a C.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading I think, but he is so biased so please be aware that if you are not girl, not 上莊lun, not social kind of person that will 奶tutor, YOU CAN BE GUARENTEED THAT HE WON'T PRETTY MUCH PAY ATTENTION TO YOU SO DON'T REG HIM!

(his kind of biased is so obvious that everyone can sense it)
reviews.comment_workload: Very heavy workload, two case analysis with two presentations. For the presentation you need to be very presentable and professional. wear suits!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: boi
reviews.title: Easy Content, Tough Grade barrier
reviews.comment_content:
Easy.

- Nothing about actual business case analysis and almost entirely about how to give presentations.
- Things like, how to make your presentations more eye catchy or keep your hands in one spot
- 2 real business cases and all the answers are given
- 0 knowledge required on anything. Extroverted or business students in general will find it extremely easy

tldr: You don't really learn anything. (good grade saver)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice guy and because the content difficulty is nonexistent, it is very chill and you can chat with him easily because the class is small.

He's very friendly and you don't have to worry about technical details in lecture content. He's also very lenient in everything besides grading.

tldr: Friendly guy, not much to learn -> not much to teach.
reviews.comment_grading:
The first tip is to suck his dick. Just be friendly with him and he'll magically give you a higher grade even for lower quality work.

- attendance [??%]
- 2 group presentations [??%]
- 2 individual reports [??%]
--- grade weighting doesn't matter because it depends on how much he likes you

- IMPORTANT: Very tough grade barrier. His grading criteria is very vague despite giving a rubric. You often won't understand why he gave you a certain grade and trying to improve on your mistakes won't change your next grade.

- how much he likes youu [magic%]
--- My group once gave a very bad presentation compared to others but he still gave us very good remarks and chastised other groups. My friend and I were very friendly and outgoing with him which contributed greatly to our grades.

tldr: suck his dick. final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
0 studying required because content is so easy there's basically nothing to study.

The projects are very basic presentations that even with poor teammates you can do the whole thing alone. (HOWEVER, pick good teammates anyway because why not??)

Sometimes I forget I even have this class. Just going to class and being friendly with him will score you at least a B.

reviews.author: 123gg
reviews.title: Bad grade course
reviews.comment_content: There will be 2 group presentations and 2 recommendation reports to complete.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching was not so bad since he was reading from the powerpoint slide for the whole semester.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is bad. It depends highly on how the professor liked the presentation and the people presenting instead of the actual performance. At first, he told us he is a fair grade professor which isn't true. If you got assigned to be in his class, better swap to another class.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine if you have good groupmates in the 2 group presentations.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.title: Don't choose this tutor if possible
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is fine.  There will be 2 case studies throughout the course.  We are required to do 2 group presentations and write 2 recommendation reports.  Presentation skills and points to note for a recommendation report will be covered.  However, how well the content is delivered hugely depends on the quality of the tutor.  A tutor reading the ppt aloud and one explains the details with solid examples makes the course content really different among various classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of William Lee is poor, really poor. Lack of examples and explanations.  I also have the feeling that he doesn't put the learning of students at the top priority (just personal feeling, no offence).  The reason I say so is that I need to ask him again and again about the grading, comments and improvements etc.  Finally, the grade and comment for the first presentation is released 1 week before the second presentation, which makes me difficult to improve accordingly.  Recommendation reports have the similar situation.  The grade and comment for the first report is released less than 1 week before the due date of the second one. And again, not much time to improve accordingly.  Not to mention that his comment is vague, say like "projection of voice is clear, pronunciation is good".  This is a Labu course, not a language course!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading of Labu 2040 is curved across all sections, ie students taught by different tutors and marked by different tutors will be curved together for the final letter grade.  Although William Lee said the presentations which have been recorded and reports will be double marked by different tutors, I doubt this.  I know there are some classes which the marks for presentations are released before my class even started presenting!!!  How can it be double marked in such a case???  That's why grading is unfair in my opinion with different standards by different tutors.
William Lee's grading is awful.  Almost all students in my class got 5 out of 7 in all categories for presentations.  Can the ability of students in the whole class be that similar??  He also once mentioned "I only gave one or two 7 marks across all my 4 sessions".  I am absolutely sure other tutors give more 7 marks then he did.  Maybe the performance of my class was really not that outstanding, but all 4 classes taught by him did not perform well??  This is really questionable.
reviews.comment_workload: The work load is fine for a 3 credit course.  As mentioned, there will be 2 group presentations and 2 reports.  No mid term nor final.  Good luck in finding some good teammates for the group presentations.

reviews.author: M_1240
reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.comment_content:
The course content focuses on case analyses.
There are four mini cases, each focusing on a certain aspect of case analyses.
You are in most cases a consultant and are required to give solutions and recommendations to companies.

There are two cases and two reports that are graded.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is an amazing teacher. He makes class interactive and interesting. He likes to use visual aid and videos while teaching.

The class is likely to be small, so he will know you personally. He likes to give the students personalized feedback for the graded cases. His feedback is extremely useful and highly effective.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you are interactive and answer regularly in class, along with being confident in your presentations, then you can expect an easy A range.

Contribute to your group's presentation and make sure you follow his pointers on how to improve.

Attendance is compulsory.
reviews.comment_workload:
You are required to do two power point presentations and two reports. Enough time is given to you to do both.

The workload besides the above stated is almost negligible. You may be required to do small power point presentations, outside of class, which do not require a lot of effort.

Attendance is compulsory. Missing out on more than 5 classes will result in failing the course.

reviews.author: Sofy Twilight
reviews.title: I don't like LABU
reviews.comment_content:
Very ordinary. Two business cases.
1. WIYCR
A resort is facing many operation difficulties including intensifying staff - management relations and increasing customer complaints. You are Patrick a business consultant, you have to do a group project with 3 other guys and do a individual recommendation report

2. Kitchen Best
A home appliances manufacturer facing corruption and backward customer relationship management system. You are still a business consultant, do a group project with 3 other guys and give the owner of Kitchen Best some suggestions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Better than most of courses in HKUST since there's only a few people in a class. She can call all of our names.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't know since I don't know my performance relative to others. But I would say the courses ruin my grades this semester, everytime I was trying to "break 4" a course of CLE would stop me from doing so.  I got competent and competent-very good in all of the tasks and fianlly got a B. Quite fair. I don't expect much and in my own estimation I thought I would get C for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy as you need to prepare a lot for the presentations.
BTW you must recite all the words in the scripts otherwise you will get mark deduction (by setting your upper limit of mark to competent, but it doesn't matter to me because I got competent for most of the tasks).

reviews.author: brittanyfcy
reviews.comment_content:
two mini business cases (not graded, use it as a chance to practice)
two business case studies
first one needed to do presentation (20%) and submit a 1000 word recommendation report (30%)
second one needed to do presentation (30%)
the remaining grading contributed by peer evaluation (5% x 2), online assignments (easy quizzes only count do or not do) and learning portfolio (8%)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kathy is quite chill in teaching, mostly discussion time in class
Pay attention when she talks about the requirements and hints for the business cases presentation and report writing, she grades according to her requirements mentioned (so don't copy from the sources)
reviews.comment_grading:
haven't release final grade
quite strict, a little unnatural or looks like memorizing the script during presentation would cause a sub-grade downwards
reviews.comment_workload:
very heavy workload, do not take two lang course in the same semester
usually only have 1-2 weeks to prepare for the presentations

reviews.author: bruhImsostresse
reviews.title: OK BUT HEAVY WORKLOAD
reviews.comment_content:
2 case studies
1st case: West Indies Yacht Club Resort Case Study. Analyze the challenges the resort is facing and provide suggestions
2nd case: Kitchen Best Case Study. Provide suggestions that can help the company to reach some ambitious goals.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fiona always engages us in class, she loves active students and she always makes sure every one of us answers her questions in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is ok. You have to be active to achieve a better grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload. In-class exercises every week, in-class presentations every few weeks. Attendance is very important in LABU courses.

reviews.author: Testing1234
reviews.title: Just reg Martha
reviews.comment_content:
Some case studies.
Case1: West Indies Yacht Club Resort Case Study. Analyze the challenges the resort is facing and provide suggestions
Case2: Kitchen Best Case Study. Provide suggestions that can help the company to reach some ambitious goals.
reviews.comment_teaching: Martha says everything clearly. You definitely know what you should do, what you should not do, and how to do better. She is open to any questions. You can send her emails anytime if you have any questions. Personally I sent her many emails and her replies help a lot. The atmosphere during the class is also good. Although only a few students are turning on their cameras during the class, Martha is still trying her best to deliver the content.
reviews.comment_grading: Very very good. Having an A range in a Labu course is much better than my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 presentations, 1 essay, and 1 learning portfolio. The workload of the essay is fine. You can finish it in 3 days if you pay attention to the lecture. The first presentation requires your group to upload and submit a 12 minutes video of a presentation about Case1. You can record the video as many times as you want. No PowerPoint is needed for presentation 1. The second presentation will be done during the last lecture. PowerPoint is required. The learning portfolio has nearly no workload. You can definitely finish it in 1 day.
The workload of the presentations heavily depends on your groupmates. If you have good groupmates (lol luckily I do), it will be good.
Also for presentation 1, you have a chance to choose your groupmates. But for presentation 2, you will be assigned to a group and you will definitely have new groupmates that you've never met.

reviews.author: Stress&tension
reviews.title: very very poorly graded!!!!! Do not reg her classes ever!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
we have 2 case studies and some mini case studies, the content is quite interesting tbh
Mainly about what strategies we can use as business consultants to improve different companies' businesses.
reviews.comment_teaching: She seems nice at first but she's really not, she treats you well if your impression is good and doesn't even give an f if she doesn't like you. It is so obvious. Sometimes her instructions are really really vague, you never know what she wants you to do and basically everything you do needs to be improved. I don't know if it's the same for all instructors but except for 2 case studies' presentations, we also have a bunch of mini presentations, basically we have homework every week.
reviews.comment_grading:
Like I said, you have a good grade if she likes you and a very very bad one if she doesn't. She would say that you should improve on different areas but not telling you how to, just criticising you. I don't know her grading criteria but it seems to be different for everyone.

For the first case study and recommendation report, I got a bunch of competent and a few very good, never knew the grade of my second case study and I ended up with a C- like what?????? Grading is not transparent at all and very random.
reviews.comment_workload: Super super heavy workload, I know many Labu classes are like this but we have to do 2 case studies, two recommendations, one recommendation report and a bunch of mini presentations and quizzes and stuff. We have homework nearly every week. Like how much work do you expect us to do within one semester????????

reviews.author: tun
reviews.comment_content:
The course focuses on five main elements:
1. Mini business cases
2. Oral communication for business
3. Business case 1
4. Written communication for business
5. Business case 2
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice and friendly. There were optional consultations for the oral presentations and the writing task. It is recommended to attend the consultation as he gives useful comments on your work.
reviews.comment_grading:
Oral presentation 1 (20%)
Peer evaluation for oral presentation 1 (2.5%)
Writing task (Individual)  (33%)
Oral presentation 2 (33%)
Peer evaluation for oral presentation 2 (2.5%)
Online assignments (4%): including Case 1 quiz, Online task, Case 2 quiz
Learning portfolio  (5%)

I got an A in this course.
My scores are below:
Oral presentation 1 (16%)
Writing task (28%)
Oral presentation 2 (29%)
Other scores will not be released.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Just read the case before the lesson. The quizzes are simple with unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: 16y39y
reviews.title: love nora she is so friendly and helpful
reviews.comment_content:
Case 1 - West Indies Yacht Club Resort
Topics: dealing with cultural differences, low staff morale, declining service levels etc.
Tasks: 12 minute presentation and 1000 word recommendation report

Case 2 - Kitchen Best
Topics: bribery, lack of corporate governance and systems in small family businesses
Tasks: 12 minute presentation with PPT slides and Q&A

To be honest, this course is taught by CLE and feels more like a language course than a business analysis course. Basic steps/frameworks for case analysis were covered, and there were guiding tasks for identifying the causes and issues, but from my experience, the grade mainly depends on your presentation and language skills. Don't expect the solutions to be grand and innovative.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nora is extremely friendly and anyone can feel that she genuinely cares for her students. She is very conversational and engaging during class. For those who want to participate, she always welcomes input and encourages you to talk. For those who don't want to talk, or are a bit less engaged to begin with, she won't cold call or pressure you either, so her classes are generally comfortable and fun to attend.

Honestly, there's not much new content to teach in this class, so Nora didn't teach anything especially amazing. However, she did a perfect job going through all the necessary prep tasks to get us ready for the case assignments and always kept us ahead of schedule. I appreciated that she always pushed us to finish our drafts or practise videos way in advance and gave us detailed feedback before our final submission. She also dedicated many lessons for consultation, which were very helpful.

One minor issue is that she has very specific taste on the solutions, language and presentation style. During our consultations, I felt that she sort of led everyone towards the same set of solutions and wordings, so there wasn't much space to think and explore on our own. But her solutions generally made sense, and she gave clear instructions on how to express the solutions she had in mind, so it wasn't that big of an issue for me.

Anyways Nora is easily the most caring and friendly instructor I've met at UST, I have no complaints about her personally at all.
reviews.comment_grading:
As with any other LANG course, grading and curves are always a mystery. From my experience (and some guessing and comparing), I think Nora's grading is not bad, to say the least, and in my case, it was pretty good. Maybe it's because she's pretty strict with the task marks (so the final grade came as a pleasant surprise).

I think on average I got 6 out of 7 for most of the criteria, with only two 6.5s and one 7. I also missed some small task during the semester and got an A in the end, which is pretty good considering my raw scores.

I found her taste/preferences a bit confusing at times, but I tried to ask for as much advice and clarification as possible and the grades turned out great in the end. Echoing one of the other reviews here about Nora, I do agree that she can feel if you put in effort, and effort seems to generally pay off with Nora.
reviews.comment_workload: Standard LANG course workload, maybe even a bit less. When compared to my friend's instructors from other sections, Nora seemed to assign us more small tasks (drafts, prep tasks, practise videos) throughout the semester, so it felt a bit more intense. But all of these tasks are helpful (either for getting a better grade or getting tasks done in advance), so I didn't mind them too much.

reviews.author: You guess!
reviews.title: Instructor: HOGUE, Tess
reviews.comment_content:
Two case analysis (West Indies Yacht Club Resort and Kitchen Best Ltd.) with two mini cases (demo only)

Content are skills about presentation and writing business reports. BUT I don't really know what I have learnt (only remember audience awareness as Tess always metioned in class)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her lessons were quite fun and not stressful as other instructor, she seldomly gave homework and we got some dance time during the lesson (like 5 mins before the end of the lesson)

She always put us into breakout room to discuss (so most of the lesson time are talking with your groupmates) and she entered the breakout room from time to time only, so I would say lessons were quite chill. She will usually find one to two groups for presenting ideas that discussed in breakout room, but she always choose the students that she likes or active.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very suprised! Although she never asks me questions during the class, she still gives me good grade, indeed unexpected because I think she will be bias and give good grades to students that she likes only.  

Assessments:
Online task + Case I quiz + Case 2 quiz (2%)
Oral group presentation 1 (20%)
Peer evaluation for oral 1 (2.5%)
Individual writting task (33%)
Oral group presentation 2 (30%)
Peer evaluation for oral 2 (2.5%)
Participation (5%)

My score:
Oral 1: 3 Competent & 1 Very good
Writing task: 3 Very good
Oral 2: 4 Very good
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
More than average because you need to do many preparation work for each assessments, especially oral presentaion.
- Oral 1 need to film yourself from head to toe for the presentation (most of my friends take at least 3 hours to film for their part, including myself)
- Oral 2 is a live presentaion with Q&A session (need to do many rehersals and make a neat and tidy powerpoint)

reviews.author: Shivangi
reviews.comment_content: LABU2040 is a very interesting course. I really enjoyed analysing and breaking down case studies. You learn a lot about making presentations, how to present, enhancing your communication skills and confidence during presentations. You learn real-life skills that will help you in the business industry in your future careers.
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally, I really enjoyed Professor Lam's teaching methods. He was very interactive and constantly provided us with opportunities to participate. Gave a lot of useful feedback and was always open to discuss any problems or questions we may have.
reviews.comment_grading:
Your groups really matter for your grading as for the presentations, you get a personal and group grade so its really important that your group members present as well as you do.
I was lucky and had good groups for both presentations, his grading is very strict and harsh. Overall, I ended up with an A. Make sure to participate a lot.
reviews.comment_workload:
- 1 mock practise presentation
- 2 graded presentations and 2 reports

You have to practice for your presentations a lot so relatively high workload.

reviews.author: chocolate lover
reviews.comment_content: The content basically is about the assignments. He will teach you some grammar and content issues for both speaking and writing such as the writing style and speaking tone.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many discussion time. But most of the time don't know what to discuss. Not enough clear instructions.
Have lots of interaction, really need pay attention to what he is saying all the time to answer him.
reviews.comment_grading:
In total of 3 assignments, 1 writing and 2 speaking.
Overall got around 70% marks for writing and the first speaking (Overall got C+). Didn't got feedback for the second speaking.

Grading is not clear, but seems to be quite harsh as groupmates got much higher marks but still B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Most discussion will finish all the stuff.

reviews.author: Robin Li
reviews.title: Good Instructor
reviews.comment_content: Useful content. LABU2040 teaches basic skills in the business case analysis. It is an introduction-level course to teach how to analyse cases in a proper manner.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eunice is so nice that she will release the heavy workload of that course. Useless reading materials and writing exercises have been deleted so that we just focus on each lesson she delivered in class. The efficiency is quite good in the class even though it is WeFr 4:30-5:50 PM session.
For tasks (writings and presentations), she will give extra consultation sessions. She is so skilled at the presentation that she can tell you how to improve on every single detail.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. I got 5 and 6 in all sections on my writing as well as presentations. Full attendance on classes. Finally, I got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Well, the workload has been released by the instructor, but I think that for other sessions the workload can be very high. Presentation exercises may be conducted during the class so that some preparations are needed to be done before the class (or you can try to practice your freestyle skills XD). Remember that you are not the top rapper on Rap China so that you should spend lots of time on preparation for two presentations.
Groupwork is also needed. Remember to ensure that everyone in the group will contribute so that it will be very efficient for you to analyse boring cases. Otherwise, you will be confused during the whole process of the preparation of your presentation. In addition, writing assignments should be also careful that there are upper limits on the word counts. You should be careful on the word choice.

reviews.author: Blind
reviews.title: don't reg this course if you can
reviews.comment_content: The content itself is interesting, but combined with workload is a nightmare. 1 Mini case and 2 main cases about different business related problems. The course materials are all uploaded to canvas, and many learning materials about the course can be google-ed.
reviews.comment_teaching: Though she is willing to answer questions, usually she just tell us something we already know. There is not much of a difference between just reading the PowerPoint and going to lesson if you don't ask questions. Note that we have to take attendance. This semester is very special and we are required to attend online classes, but it is a nightmare. Mainly just talking about marking scheme, but the marking scheme of case 1 and case 2 is the same, so mainly talking rubbish.
reviews.comment_grading: The worst part about this course. Her grading is very tough, and I can't make out her logic on grading. For example, she especially like to emphasize on hand gestures and seems to pay less attention to the actual content and the visual aids. To add insult to injury, her grading is extremely slow. When I'm writing the report for Case 2, she still haven't given us the grading for Case 1. I seriously don't know how to get a good grade in this course without feedback.
reviews.comment_workload: Please get good teammates. The most important aspect of this course. If you want to reg this course, I recommend you reg with a friend. If you don't have good teammates, I don't know how you are going to carry yourself and your team. Though the assignments and presentation itself is not that difficult, it is hard to coordinate with your group members. Communication and teamwork is key in this course.

reviews.author: gd
reviews.comment_content: 成個course主要係Case Study，兩個case都分別各有一個Presentaion同Report！主要都係叫你針對個Case諗下recommendation，又會教下啲presenation skills同點寫report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Martha教得好好，不過有時有啲位都小小悶。佢會講得好清楚佢expect你要做到嘅嘢。唔明又可以問佢，佢好樂意解答！
reviews.comment_grading:
好好Grade！只要做到佢叫你做嘅嘢都唔會差得去邊！本身expect B or B+, 完全無諗過可以有A range！

Attendance 都好重要！
reviews.comment_workload:
我覺得都算輕鬆！主要都係Presentaion同寫Report！要睇下會唔會同其他科Presentation撞，我就好好彩無所以覺得Workload一啲都唔重！
同埋都好睇Groupmate，Martha兩次都係Random咁form group。我啲Groupmate就比較Prefer練好多次先去Presentation，呢啲位都會比較花時間。

reviews.author: MasT
reviews.title: Labu 2040
reviews.comment_content:
very heavy workload
two mini cases for us to get familiar with case analysis
two assessments in total, group formed randomly.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice and funny, but is he so strict that for presentation, if you don't walk around or don't make interactions with audience, you cant get an A.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is really bad. For the four tasks, i get an average of 5/7 but at last my grade is C+. Just dont reg Levi! Poor grade af.
reviews.comment_workload: There are two presentation and writing needed to be done in the whole semester. All of them are quite required time to finished as you need to read the articles and discuss with your groupmates.

reviews.author: Terencewhyy
reviews.comment_content: Boring content regarding presentation and case analysis. The two cases given were so standard that difficult to differentiate among peers.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is fair that strictly follows the guidelines given by the LABU team. Anthony seldom make modifications to the content. Basically you can pre-visit all the content in the beginning of the semester for a better understanding. However, most lessons are not too funny with discussions in small groups.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average as mostly guided by the LABU team. However, it is rather difficult to get good grades for the 2 presentations. The grading is better for the recommendation reports however the percentage for report is less than presentation. Other tutors might give out more excellents than Anthony in presentations.

For individual grading and impression marking, Anthony favors international students more that usually give good grades to westerners. If you are from mainland or asian countries that do not speak fluent English, I strongly advice you NOT to register for Anthony's LABU. He focuses on pronunciation rather than content as all labu tutors do.
reviews.comment_workload: Light work load. Usually preparation for discussions and reading of case materials. No big pressure.

reviews.author: cslamae
reviews.comment_content: rich in content of business cases and presentation skills. Very useful and practical. It absolutely helps you get a deeper understanding of how an analyst should solve cases and interpret solutions in a modern light.
reviews.comment_teaching: Inspiring and interesting. Levi keeps you spirited and excited throughout the whole lesson every time. He is really humorous and likes playing jazz music whensoever students are engaged in group discussions. However, he rarely responds to emails from students, if not ignores them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Sadly, Levi is heard to be the strictest among all in terms of grading. In reality, yes he is. As compared to other tutors, he is unbelievably strict. Since this course is under absolute grading system, doing better than your classmates does not guarantee you a good grade if the whole class overall receives unacceptably low marks in tasks.

No exams.
(Two speaking two writing tasks, 20% 25% 20% 25%: participation 5%; peer evaluation 5%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely high. Case studying and presentation every week nearly.

Levi is also way more demanding in beforehand preparations than other tutors. If you are to register his class, please do make sure you have read all the materials and prepared the solutions to the questions and of course, prepare your presentations. OR ELSE, well, you gotta be careful about your grade.

reviews.author: lemonswirls

I find it really useful :)
reviews.comment_teaching:

He gave out free snacks last term XD not sure if he is still doing that now.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is okay. Final presentation and report grade was not revealed.
reviews.comment_workload:
As long as you are not a deadline fighter like me, you'll be fine.
First several weeks : 100 words essay per meeting
Mid semester : Small presentation and Business Case
End semester : Business Case

goodluck :")

reviews.author: hnc

reviews.comment_workload: All LABU classes have heavy workload. With two presentations and one paper assignment. the presentation part will be demanding and you need to write and remember all the scripts. the paper is due in the end of the semester, which can be done within a day.

reviews.author: mambaBY

reviews.author: dying
reviews.title: Register his course if you are a talkative, extroverted non-local student!
reviews.comment_content:
LABU  2040  is  a  graded,  one-semester  course  worth  three  credits.  The  course  focuses  on these main elements.

1. Two mini business cases
2. Oral communication for business  
3. Business case 1 (about cultural differences)
4. Written communication for business (a recommendation report)
5. Business case 2 (about receiving kickbacks)
6. Reflections of all activities before the recommendation report (at the end of the semester)
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is nice and friendly. He is very responsive, and he replied to my emails within minutes (except for weekends). He really likes responsive and engaging students who answer his questions and give out comments during classes. However, his emails often missed out on some information or attachments of the cases, or some mistakes, which confused the whole class. So you better email him if you have any concerns about the cases you will be having in his class.
reviews.comment_grading: Nick likes subtle details about the solutions you are presenting, it was very difficult to include many details and planning within the short 12-min presentation, without speaking very fast (which he hates it). Very frustrating. He is also the course head of LABU so he is very strict about the performance of your presentations. It is hard to score a good, high mark from him, unless you have ways to impress him.
reviews.comment_workload: This course requires very heavy attention and effort if you are not talented in presentations and want to get a good grade. As you can see from the contents, there are 2 mini cases and big cases, as well as 1 report and tons of reflection writing. He also requires you to have a practice presentation for the 2 big cases, so you have to be prepared all the time, and ask for his feedback and comments. I don't recommend enrolling in LABU 2040 if you are planning to have a 18-credit semester, as this course is fking tiring with no breaks. Work piles and tasks were never-ending, presentation after presentation until the start of final exam study break.

reviews.author: Cactusssss
reviews.comment_content: Not really useful and practical content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite interactive. He always asks us questions and there is much group discussion time. It will be a bit horrible for introverts.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. He didn't release the score of the assignments so I am not sure whether my report and online learning portfolio are doing quite well or not (but I did put the effort into doing the assignment).
2. For presentation 1, I didn't recite the script.

My grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
HEAVY WORKLOAD
2 case analysis (you need to recite the script...)
2 quit (unlimited attempt, you can get full credit once you submit them)
1 report (ard 1000 words)
1 online learning portfolio (you need to make a website lol)

reviews.author: Sisst
reviews.title: I like it.
reviews.comment_content: Basically it thought us how to give a presentation and a recommendation report on a professional business setting. Strategies and approaches to tackle different cases and different audiences. It also gives practice on working well with your team and having good synergy.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like her teaching style. For the most of it, on classes she just explains a few things briefly and gave us directions on how to tackle the case as well as presenting them. After she finished explaining we can just work with our group freely while following her guidance from earlier which will cumulatively contribute to our projects, mainly the oral presentations rather than the writing report. She is also very reasonable if you wanna negotiate or argue for a grade raise.
reviews.comment_grading: I got really good marks (almost full band) on both my oral presentations. For the writing report I initially got vg/vg/ex but request for a raise with sufficient argument and was raised to vg/vg-ex/ex. My team also asked for a raise on our second oral presentation and she gave us the raise. She actually provides session for us to ask for a grade raise if we'd like and as long as we give valid and strong reasoning she will most likely give us the raise. I got A+ and a lot of students in my class got A range. But then again she did say our section was exceptionally good compared to other sections. Grading is absolute BTW.
reviews.comment_workload: It has proper workload. She gave 2 in class quizzes which were basically free points. The writing report was probably the one that took the most labor, as it is individual, but still very ok I think. The oral presentations were group based and definitely needs several meetings and preparations but I think it is ok. It is not a difficult course but you definitely need to spend time and effort working on your projects as well as coordinating with groupmates.

reviews.author: 184k041
reviews.title: Fair grading with fair workload
reviews.comment_content:
Two business case analyses
Mainly teaching oral presentation skills like tone and language and body language, and writing skills like organization and language.
reviews.comment_teaching: The atmosphere was always relaxing, the lecturer basically just followed the PowerPoint slides for teaching. He also provided useful feedback based on each student's case.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st Case Analysis:
-Quiz 1%
-Group Oral Presentation (12min) 20%
-Peer Evaluation 5%
-Individual Recommendation Report (1000w) 30%

2nd Case Analysis:
-Quiz 1%
-Group Oral Presentation (12min) + Q&A (4min) 30%
-Peer Evaluation 5%

-Learning Portfolio 8%

My grade:
Both quizzes full mark
1st presentation: 6,6,6,6 out of 7
Report: 5,4,4 out of 7
2nd presentation: 5,5,5,5 out of 7
Learning portfolio: 3 out of 4
Final letter grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
"Quiz": 10 mc questions about the content of the case, open book (easy)
Group Presentation: a 5min practice presentation is held before each final presentation, it is not graded but is useful for receiving comments. The presentation requires a nice PowerPoint as well.
Writing Report: not hard to do but have to be careful about the tone and language
Learning Portfolio: in the form of google sites/office sway with reflections on the previous presentations, requires to attach videos on the portfolio.
No quiz or midterm or final exam.

Overall:
The workload is average for a LANG course. However, it might be hard for someone who doesn't like presentations as there are 4 presentations to be prepared in total.

reviews.author: Prudencia_L
reviews.title: Instructors HON Ka Ling Sylvia
reviews.comment_content: Just normal LABU content, pretty boring and useless, and SO FAR AWAY from the real world. But Sylvia didn’t require much extra tasks so good, and she made the course quite interactive.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sylvia is actually new to teaching LABU course. She’s a very passionate and genuine person, and you can tell that she actually cares about teaching and her students. She’s very willing to offer help, as long as you’re proactive and reach out.

reviews.author: carpeDiem
reviews.title: Luck plays a significant role in the final course grade
reviews.comment_content:
Please refer to others' reviews...
As a final-year student who has participated in case competitions and done some internships in the past, I actually find this course useful.

Presentation skills are absolutely important in business settings and critical thinking/problem-solving skills are highly demanded by the workforce.
Business writing is also useful when you enter the workforce.

I would recommend students take this course after 3rd year... For 1st or 2nd-year students, you probably won't recognize the practicality of this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Self-intro sharing in our first lesson --> set an amiable atmosphere and allowed me to learn more about my classmates
- Nick is available to answer my concerns promptly in emails
- Nick provides clear grading rubrics for the case presentations. The considerate notes are fairly helpful for us to prepare in advance of our presentation.
- Nick is very enthusiastic and shares a lot about himself (background, experience in teaching)
- Abundant external learning resources (e.g. Case competition video on YouTube)
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Oral video presentation 1 + peer eval (20% + 5%)
2. Individual writing task 1000 words max. (30%)
3. Oral presentation 2 + peer eval (35%)
4. Online assignments on cases (2%)
5. Individual learning portfolio (8%)

He allows you to find your own group mates for the second case. Be proactive and find good groupmates early!!

Personally, I think this is a good grade course because my classmates were mostly too passive and too shy to speak in class... Usually, it was me and another proactive student responding to Nick in class.

Many of my classmates were taking this course in their final semester so they were probably not motivated to be proactive in class.

It would be naive to think that LABU 2040 is all about pleasing the instructor (I don't agree with the previous review of "sucking his dick").

Being open-minded to communicating with others regardless of your introversion or extroversion and taking ownership of your work should be the essence of getting a decent grade for this course.

I got "very good to excellent" in both of my case presentations. Not sure about the grade I received for the other sections. Eventually, I received an unexpectedly decent grade in the A range.



Good luck.
reviews.comment_workload:
Case Presentations：
It depends on your groupmates.

I got a super responsive and helpful groupmate for the 1st case (so lucky to get assigned into the same group as the proactive girl in class!!) Working with proactive and driven people will make you sleep better at night!

For the 2nd case, I also got lucky to work with easy-going and responsible teammates.

Business writing - recommendation report：
Very different from academic writing but you could schedule a consultation with Nick and ask for his feedback on 1 paragraph to correct and improve any misconceptions about business writing.

Quiz:
In-class open-book quiz. Nick will go through the answers in class and you have unlimited attempts --> easy to obtain full mark

reviews.author: 棉花糖
reviews.title: Good English does not guarantee good grades
reviews.comment_content:
Overall: The content should be pretty similar across all instructors and semesters, given the 2 business cases used within the course should be the same.
1. Mini business cases
2. Oral communication for business
3. Business case 1
4. Written communication for business
5. Business case 2
reviews.comment_teaching:
Overall: I would say the class liked Jason, for he takes a more relaxed approach in lessons - he makes jokes, shares his first job experience working for Jardines, chats with us etc. The vibe is pretty chill indeed.

One good thing to note is Jason is pretty responsive to emails, so you could definitely reach him through emails. You could ask him questions regrading assignments and the course, but don't expect him to give you personal feedback for the report which I believe is paramount to the final letter grade.

As for the teaching, Jason did a pretty good job in making comments on what we should bear in mind in writing the report. However, it still comes down to whether you can execute the proper 'tone' emphasized by Jason (I guess this is where the English matters part kicks in).
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall: Um... As the title summarizes, personally speaking, it is a little disappointing. Fyi, I transferred credits for the English language courses, and according to my academic advisor, she told me this course depends heavily on your English level, but according to my experience, it takes much more than that. Good English is not enough. You also have to have the right tone and register for the report and make good presentations to secure A range I believe. More importantly, since the class size is small (less than 20 students), you can imagine even a minor discrepancy in each of your graded work could result in a difference of a sub grade.

Breakdown:
Case 1&2 quizzes (credit on submission): submitted
Attendance (80% is required): full attendance
For oral presentations, the scale is as follows (in descending order):
Excellent, Very Good, Competent, Satisfactory, Marginal, Unsatisfactory
Oral Presentation 1:
1. Task Completion (30%) VG
2. Organization & Teamwork (20%): VG/Comp
Recommendation report:
Task completion: Satisfactory/Marginal
Organization: Competent
Language use: Competent

Final letter grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
It wasn't high for me. But if you aim for A range, you should definitely start working earlier and put in more effort. I think you have to nail the report plus both presentations. So I will briefly talk about what you can do to get a better grade (maybe what I should have done lol), you can take it as a reference, especially if Jason's your instructor.

For the report, make good use of the consultation session with Jason by coming to it prepared. Don't be like me and deadline fight the report and not being able to get feedback from Jason. It will be the only chance for you to get his feedback, as Jason is fair to all students and would not give you personal feedback outside of the consultation sessions he set up for everyone.

For the first case presentation, focus on the oral part. Our group got Jason's comment the ppt slides were too eye catching (should've not made the ppt slides instead). And since we did it on Zoom, make sure the video featuring your faces is big enough. Ours were too small for Jason (we used Zoom's recording feature).

For the second case presentation, we get to do it in person. Everyone was pretty nervous haha. So be sure to rehearse it thoroughly so you won't stutter and can be confident in front of an audience of 10 people.

I think that's pretty much it for the workload. Though there're still quizzes regrading the cases, it isn't that time-consuming as long as you have read the case. But since this course is group project based, having responsive group mates would make a big difference. Jason requires the class to work with different classmates for the 2 cases. You can probably imagine pairing up with competent group mates would make a huge difference. Final words would be Jason indeed seems nice, but the grading could be pretty harsh as the class size is pretty small, so put in effort just like for other courses to avoid poor grades.

reviews.author: Esther Man
reviews.comment_content:
There are two business cases to analyse, one did on class and one did by our own group. You can learn some presentation skills and management styles there.

Have to do two presentation, write a formal report and do a learning porfolio.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching atmosphere is quite relaxing overall.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite tight grading, in my opinion. Since group presentations account for a large portion of your grade and everyone in your group receives the same score, you won't be graded individually unless you end up with a free-rider or someone difficult to work with.

There are a few simple online tests (to evaluate your knowledge of the cases and other material), but they are all based on participation, so everyone will receive the full mark.

Remembe to choose your groupmate carefully as it will really affect your grade a lot.
reviews.comment_workload: It depends on how hardworking you are for the group project. If you have a groupmate with excellent English and presentation skills, your workload is definitely reduced.

reviews.author: BusyBee
reviews.comment_content:
To put it simply: 2 Business Cases, each one you explore in the class together and at the end has to do a group presentation.

You're supposed to learn real-life business analytical skills as well as language skills from this course, but I'd say to be completely frank it feels more like a language course because they focus more on teaching "presentation skills" rather than the actual business solution/ recommendation.

Overall though, I think this course is useful because in real life we also need to know how to use our language and speech skills to get through life, even if what we're saying is bs hahaha

If your English skills/ presentation skills are good or you're comfortable presenting to an audience, this course is easy! For introverts/ those with stage fright or students with weak language skills, maybe not...
reviews.comment_teaching:
I liked my instructor, he would share his real-life stories to make us understand the points he was bringing up.

One thing, though, is that you have to be quite self-motivated for this course since group work and presentations make up the majority of your grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say fair grading. Unless you end up with a free-rider or someone hard to work with, since group presentations make up a high percentage of your grade, and everyone in your group gets the same grade—you're not marked individually.

There're some online quizzes (to test your knowledge about the cases and stuff) but those are all based on participation so everyone would get the full mark for those.

There's also a "Written Report" where you detail the recommendation for case 1 in a formal business manner. This accounts for 28% of your grade or so.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair. I wouldn't say heavy, but obviously, any project/ presentation based course has its own type of workload. If you do things on time and get good teammates, you'll be fine.

reviews.author: Nickim
reviews.comment_content: 主要內容是跟consulting有關的，都是一些入門的case practice.
