Quite time consuming for each presentation. It is best when you can coordinate your teammates to input as much so things go smoothly and everyone gets a good grade.

reviews.author: xxyyzz
reviews.title: Nice tutor and grading
reviews.comment_content:
Case 1 - Western Indies Yacht Club (Speech)
You have to record a video with your groupmates and submit it. You can record it separately and merge it together later so it will be easier. And you have to modify the speech into the report and submit it as an assignment.

Case 2 - Kitchen Best (Report)
You have to present it in the class in front of Jason and classmates with a well-designed business PowerPoint.

Basically, you have to investigate the problems of the company and give recommendations according to the specified target audience in the required text type.

Learning portfolio
Sum up what you have learned in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: He didn't really focus a lot on teaching about the textbook, he focused on the main point (eg leadership styles, presentation skills...) Therefore, we are always a few lessons ahead of the schedule, which is great in my opinion cause we skipped some lessons and turned it into zoom instead. Our lessons are mainly for discussion on case studies (chatting). He gave us detailed feedback on our reports and presentations. He replies emails quickly too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance is not graded but participation. I attended all but I rarely speak up unless I have to answer his questions.
I think he did not disclose the marks of cases 1 and 2, he just gave feedback.
I originally thought I couldn't get an A range because there were many extroverts (like around half of the class) who were extremely good in class. End up getting an A- which was quite surprising.
reviews.comment_workload:
For each case, there will be a small quiz. The mark doesn't matter as long as you finish all questions.
For the case study, it really depends on your groupmate. You will only need to work on one body paragraph if your groupmates are not freerider, so the workload is not heavy at all.
I think that Jason's workload is relatively less than other tutors according to my friends.

reviews.author: inthewonderland
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about 2 business cases.
Doreen will assign you with 2~3 classmates randomly to finish the presentations (you will meet different teammates in every presentation). Before the presentations, we had a Q&A class that you could mainly receive PEER evaluation instead of Doreen's comments (doreen will not give comments about the content).
And we needed to finish a recommendation report for case 1 individually.
There were many discussions during the class to help us understand the cases. It would be better to jot some notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
So so.
Doreen has a funny character. Sometimes she will make some jokes. However, I do not think she prepared very well for the lesson... I felt that she was unfamiliar with the cases. She suggested a set of answers in one lesson, but then abolished it in the next lesson... That created great confusion for us...

If you want to clearly understand how she assesses the report/test, you should ask her directly. Do not expect that she will provide clear examples... She just simply asked us to check the vague guidelines on canvas and go through the textbooks(though she mentioned that the examples in the textbook are bad).
btw it's hard to find the materials on canvas...it's a mess :/ and she names all doc in a similar way
reviews.comment_grading:
Good.
Mainly Comp~VG
final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable.
-2 presentation (2nd is f2f)
-report
-online quizzes(each questions state where you can find the ans)
-a learning profolio (provide learning evidence & evaluate your teammate and yours performance)

reviews.author: Waynebb
reviews.title: DON'T REG JASON
reviews.comment_content:
The content is a bit messy. It is not organised. It is a bit hard to follow.
And the schedule of this course is ridiculous, we spent so much time on case 1 but so little on case 2.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is normal. As this is the first small-sized class for me. I like it a lot, we got to interact with other students and exchange ideas.
reviews.comment_grading:
I paid most effort in this course for this semester, but the grading is the shittiest I have ever seen.
He doesn't give clear guidelines on how he would grade.
He said "good! nice!" on every piece of your work but then give you a C.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not super big, but it is still big when compared to other courses (such as ISOM2010) (esp with this shitty grade ^^).
1 recommendation reports
2 presentation (1 video recording, 1 during classes)
2 quizzes
1 learning portfolio
and a few other stuff during classes.

reviews.author: Hi_everyone
reviews.title: Subjective and poor grade, I hate LABU
reviews.comment_content:
About business case study and consulting.
You will have 2 cases to work with, both are related to so-called "real-life" business, but both cases are out-dated.
There is literally no "content" or "knowledge" you can take away from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would say her teaching is not bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
May's grading is very strict and subjective.
She will keep rasing the bar and requirements, and you can never satisfy all her requirements.
She gave out a lot of 4 and 5.
If you do not "pretend to be nice and proactive" in her lessons, she may give you even lower scores.
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely heavy, while all the assignments (except the written report) is nonsense.

reviews.author: haha12345
reviews.title: many group work and quite demanding if you have a lot of courses
reviews.comment_content:
2 case (prep slides for 1 case only)
1 written hw
1 recommendation report
2 presentations
reviews.comment_teaching: Sandy Chan, who is a new lecturer to HKUST in 2021 fall. She is passionate about teaching and answering students' questions. Very encouraging in class, even your answers are kind of cliche and "trash talk", she will appreciate your effort in participation.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is strict on presentation skills. You really have to practice natural body language and wide variation on tone and engagement with the audience. So that you can get better grading on 2 presentations.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is quite large, you have to prepare for 2 cases, 1 recommendation report, and 1 micro homework throughout the course. If you prep yourself by reading the case seriously, you will get the case carking framework more easily. The cases are old and have many online resources. The suggestion and strategies you offered are not that important, instead how you present and cooperate with your teammates is more important to get an A-/A

reviews.author: on99spongebob
reviews.comment_content:
The course focuses on five main elements:
1. Mini business cases
2. Mini In-class Presentations
3. Two Major Business cases with written report plus presentation

Case 1 - West Indies Yacht Club Resort
Tasks: 12 minute presentation and Q&A, and 1000 word recommendation report

Case 2 - Kitchen Best
Tasks: 12 minute presentation with PPT slides and Q&A
reviews.comment_teaching:
I wanna be honest. Umm before I took this course I saw many comments saying this instructor teaching is good and give leng grade blablabla.... but I did not experience any of that.

During lessons I think we went off-track quite often and in the end had to rush through several topics without clear clarification or in-depth discussion on those topics, which is very problematic as you have to figure out how to do several major tasks on your own.
If you got any problems you can find him or email him but do not expect too much as I found him to be quite unresponsive to students' concerns.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading details are unclear, but seems to be quite harsh (my own experience and students from other groups).

Totally NOT leng grade and I have warned you here.

You will get a total score upon request but sub-scores will not be released and he won't explain how he gave the grades even if you ask for them, so basically there is no way to appeal as you have no grading details.
reviews.comment_workload:
The usual thing, same workload as any other language related courses, except for a few extra in-class presentations he gave on his own.

Just read the cases before lesson and you should do fine.

reviews.title: Chan, Sandy
reviews.comment_content:
Online assignment - 4%
Peer evaluation - 4%
Discussion skills - 8%
Learning portfolio - 8%
Oral presentation 1 - 20%
Oral presentation 2 - 28%
Recommendation report - 28%

2 case readings required and both presentations are group work.

The online assignments are just simple tasks, including 1 word hw and 2 online quizzes. Questions for the quizzes are easy and they are graded based on completion.

Oral presentation 1 requires you to submit in recording format while presentation 2 is conducted f2f with Q&A session. No Q card is allowed.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sandy is a really good and and nice teacher! (It seems that she is a new professor to ust.) She is very easy-going and quite funny. She likes to chat with students and the atmosphere of the class is quite chilled. I had thought of dropping this course at first to make a better timetable but I think Sandy is a professor that is worth staying for. Her teaching is also very clear with detailed explanation and materials provided. Feel free to ask her any questions, she is always willing to help!
reviews.comment_grading:
Mostly "Very Good" and a few "Excellent" and "Competent".

Got an A- at last. Quite fair grading(?) tho I've expected an A before. Idk the other's grade so it's hard to compare. However, I heard many people said this is a bad grade course so I guess it partly depends on the prof.
reviews.comment_workload:
Except the assignments mentioned in content, sometimes there are out-of-class works to do. The 2nd presentation requires much more preparations. Also the deadline is quite close together during the 2nd half of the semester. So the workload can be heavy sometimes.

To secure a decent or good grade, having good and helpful group mates is important. But I would say effort is definitely needed in this course and you cannot just count on the others.

reviews.author: Yayx14
reviews.title: Nora is the best choice
reviews.comment_teaching: Nora is the best lang tutor ever. She could motivate students to engage in this course. Her teaching is clear and she will guide you through the process. Just follow what she said then you will have your grade secured. She knows that we have heavy workload and extends the deadline. To help us to reduce the workload, she will divide the whole work into pieces so that we could finish them one by one and prevented deadline fighters.
reviews.comment_grading:
Nora have the absolute grading.
I agree that she gives mark according to the effort you've paid. It's important to have improvement.
Given that I've got B to C range in lang courses, Nora give me A- and it's really generous.
I've got an average ~5.8 out of 7.
reviews.comment_workload: some readings after classes and need to discuss with classmates.

reviews.author: know.nth
reviews.title: ok leng grade
reviews.comment_content:
A PowerPoint slide for every lesson.
Two case studies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Melissa is a nice and friendly professor. She would play a song before she started the lesson. You can recommend her some songs! She is willing to answer questions that students ask in the lessons or through emails.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading if you put your effort into both case studies.
reviews.comment_workload:
You will work in a team for all the case studies. You would have to present for both case studies. You would also have to write an essay for the first case study.
Overall workload is not too heavy if you meet some good groupmates.

reviews.author: piglet
reviews.title: leng grade Labu course
reviews.comment_content: There will be a power point slide every lesson.  There are 2 main case studies.  Throughout the whole course, you will be able to learn how to analyse a business case and present it to different audiences.
reviews.comment_teaching: Melissa is a great professor.  She is very nice and friendly.  She would play a song before the start of each lesson, which is quite interesting.  She is also willing to answer every question that students raised and help students to attain their learning goals.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is a good grade course if you are willing to put effort in the two main case studies as their weights are quite heavy.  Most of the students got B range or above in my class.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy as you will work in team for those two main case studies.  The first case studies will be handed in by video presenting while the second one will be presented through zoom.  For the second case study, there will be Q&A section, so you better get fully prepared before the presentation date.

reviews.author: aammuukk
reviews.title: Nice Tutor!
reviews.comment_content: 2 case studies in total, video presenting and writing report for the first case, zoom presentation for the second case.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice, friendly and willing to help students. He speaks in an appropriate speed and his english accent is good. He is not too harsh in grading yet sometimes he has high expectations to students, for example the design or layout of the powerpoint slides during presentation.
reviews.comment_grading: Not too bad grading
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy workload, spending more time on preparing the presentation and report. Sometimes there are quizzes and worksheet to complete.

reviews.author: helloworld69
reviews.title: most useless course in ust
reviews.comment_content: honestly, I don't know what I have really learnt from this course. It is 10x more useless than labu 2060. They basically teach you how to present, which we have all learnt before in secondary school already.
reviews.comment_teaching: every lesson is basically a discussion and Nick will say something funny yet pointless and not practical at all
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is terrible !!!!!! If you want to have a good grade, don't ever choose Nick !!! He warned us our grade will not be based on absolute grading and only a small amount of people will have an A range.

He also told our group that our presentations were great yet I got a B-. So don't ever choose his course if you want to have an A range in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. As I remembered, there were only a few presentations and online discussions.

reviews.author: GG000
reviews.title: Great teacher, Poor course
reviews.comment_content: This course focuses on presentation skill which is quite important in every stage of our life. How to arouse audience attention. The importance to avoid some wordings in presentation. How to use body gesture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tess is a funny teacher. She is willing to share her own experience which helps us understand the course materials thoroughly, and make the class more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: Not transparent. To be honest, if you are reading this course review, you probably took the lang1002 and lang1003. Like what you have experienced, the grading is not transparent. You will not know what are the numerical scores you receive for each presentation or report. What you would receive is "Satifactory" , "Very Good" and etc. Therefore, I cannot really tell much about the grading. And I think that's why it is very important to take the class which taught by lenient teacher in every language course.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy. Really heavy. There are two cases for you to study throughout the course. You will be in a group of 4 or 5. For the first case, you will have to take a 12-15 mins of video to present. For the second, you will have to present in class which also last for 12-15 mins. They seem to be fair. However, the problem is there are reports for you to write! They are right after the presentation. In a short period of time, perhaps 1 to 2 weeks, you will have to submit two very heavily weighted assignment. Time management is really something. But, you can only write the complete report after the presentation as you will change or speak wrongly in the presentation.

reviews.author: little ass
reviews.comment_content:
2 business cases: The West Indies Yacht Club Resort and Kitchen Best, you can look up summaries and even recommendations online
the task is to analyze the problems and come up with recommendations
i guess it's similar to management consulting
didn't teach practical techniques when doing these analyses but did try to guide us by teaching different work culture
reviews.comment_teaching:
william is very friendly and funny
classes are very interactive, ask each student a lot of easy questions which wouldn't put you on the spot
reviews.comment_grading:
superrr good grade if you're active in class and memorize your script well
what you need to do is just answer questions when no one does and be always punctual (or even early)
be the favorite in class and you'll get an A
case 1 (The West Indies Yacht Club Resort):
presentation 24/28
written report 17/21
case 2 (Kitchen Best):
presentation 23/28
got A
reviews.comment_workload:
mainly 2 group presentation (grouped by instructor), 1 written report
need to read 2 cases, make 2 ppt, write 2 scripts and a 1000-word written report
not heavy if you don't mind making slides and memorizing script

reviews.author: littlepear
reviews.title: A GOOD instructor really matters!
reviews.comment_content:
2 Case Studies for the whole course
- 2 group presentation
- 1 writing task
reviews.comment_teaching:
A nice instructor that gives very clear instructions. She's willing to answer all your questions. If you're not sure about your recommendation, just go and ask her. Her preference is quite obvious I would say. She would tell you whether your solution is workable or not (we all know there could be many ways to solve the issue but just go for what she wants) Always remember she's the one who grade your work!

P.S. If you're an introvert like me, you can ask questions after class or via email, Nora would definitely reply it
reviews.comment_grading: Actually, Nora gives pretty good grades. I didn't get any "Excellent" in the presentation but still got an A- at the end. I'm a local and don't speak like a native. As long as you show your improvement, Nora would appreciate it. It really doesn't matter if you don't speak perfect english.
reviews.comment_workload: We all felt like it was a 4 cred course XD. As there are 2 group presentation, you have to spend time to discuss with your groupmates and rehearse. I think there's no free-riding problem in this course due to the small class size. Nora would give us time to finish the related tasks in class as well, which is helpful for the presentation.

reviews.title: Tess is very nice!
reviews.comment_content: The course mainly teaches you how to make a good impression and raise the audience's awareness in your presentation. There are 2 oral presentations and one recommendation report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tess is very nice and she always comforts and encourages us even we make some mistakes during the daily discussion. She always shares her own experience and gives very clear guidelines to us during the consultation. I am quite chill during the lesson compared with other tutors since my friend said that his tutor is really chur and always asks students questions. You can reg her if you want to be more relaxed during the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is fair. She will not give you the exact score for your presentation and report, but only give you the range like competent, very good, and satisfactory that you get. You can get B range if you get many competent and a few very good for your presentations and report.
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload really depends on whether you want to get a good grade in the course. The main workload is preparing for the 2 presentations. You need to practice many times with your groupmates if you want to get a better grade. Also, there are 1 report and 1 learning portfolio. I think the workload is normal.

reviews.author: Maisiec
reviews.title: Friendly and Humorous Professor
reviews.comment_content: Two business case analyses, nothing special in terms of content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is a great professor. I love his lesson a lot as he always uses fun daily life examples to illustrate the concept. Even 9 am lesson people stay awake lol Not sure he is a killer or not but his lesson really worth to attend
reviews.comment_grading: Not as bad as I imagine. Some reviews saying that the course is really bad in grading, while I got a satisfactory grade (in my opinion). Not easy to get an A, mainly B+ or B I think.
reviews.comment_workload: A bit high workload and those business cases are not easy to handle. Two presentations, one written report and one self-learning portfolio.

reviews.author: yoyo22leung
reviews.title: online teaching
reviews.comment_content: um... actually I cannot link the content to case analyses but the course at least teaches the skills and the steps, maybe my English is so poor
reviews.comment_teaching:
um...quite interesting, breakout room discussion in every class
did not complete the content on time, but she sent email to us for additional information
it is optional for whether open the camera or not at the beginning but compulsory at the last 3 week
reviews.comment_grading: Not yet release, but the expectation seems to be high and my English is poor, so I expect I am going to have a C range, but I think the grading of each task are fair
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that heavy compared to other courses if your group do not have freerider
2 small quizzes about the 2 cases (Resort, Kitchen Best)
2 presentations, 1 online, 1 video
1 written report
1 learning portfolio, write reflection

reviews.author: JanetRyu
reviews.comment_content:
two online quiz
two cases
first case: presentation + report writing
second case: presentation
portfolio submission
reviews.comment_teaching: Average, the content is not hard. There are breakout group activity in each class
reviews.comment_grading:
The expectation is really high so the grades are lower than expected.
The assignment sometimes does not link to what she teaches but when you make just one mistake you will have one lower grade down.
reviews.comment_workload: heavy as she cannot finish the class material on time so she gives us the left over as homework very often so there are much work to do.

reviews.author: BlaBlaBla
reviews.comment_content:
Same as other LABU2040 classes
2 cases to analyze

[Zoom class]
Case 1: video presentation + written report
Case 2: video presentation only
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fair, not bad.
Although he will just follow what the PowerPoint wrote. But at least he taught quite clearly. And you can know what he wants for the present/report if you pay attention. (One bad thing is that sometimes I can't hear what he said, maybe it's the problem of the mic)
However, Colin is VERY LAZY on replying to our email. Me and my classmates sent many emails to him during the semester, but he didn't reply to any one of our emails...... So if you want to ask him questions, you can just ask him during classes/after classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading. In fact, I think the grading is quite good when compared to other classes. Just speak more and let Colin remember you. Not as bad grading as others sad.
I got slightly above mean for both video presentation, and mean for the written report. At last got A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload when compared to other tutors.
You just have to attend every lesson on time and finish 2 presentations + 1 written report.
(In fact even we were late for a while, it's ok)
Other tutors may have tasks for you to do after each lesson, but Colin will just give some in-class exercises/activities which is very easy. So you don't need to work after the lesson.

reviews.author: deetee
reviews.title: Be very careful with this course
reviews.comment_content: Very boring content honestly. They don't change it, and most people copy everything. Can't do much about it, though. Suck it up, SBM kids! We don't have a choice but to get thru this boring one
reviews.comment_teaching:
Colin is definitely a funny guy, but not the best Instructor. His cat was always on the Zoom call which made it a bit entertaining LOL
He does not tell you many things, esp not the important stuff - things like you're not allowed to use note cards in the recording.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not rewarded for the effort or quality :(
Please don't go for Colin if you want good grades
reviews.comment_workload: just 2 presentations and 1 report. Nothing extraordinary.

reviews.author: MarkWong
reviews.comment_content:
A little complicated but you can always ask the tutor
Every case is around 12 pages long.
The relationship between each person in the case is very complicated. You won't get it right even if you spend 5 years on that case. So don't worry about it
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear and interactive
Stop thinking. Just pick Martha.
She is very nice and gives clear instructions.
If you ask her, you will get the answer.

And she doesn't ask you to present for mini cases, so pretty LOW WORKLOAD
reviews.comment_grading:
Nothing to complain
I got A-
And I didn't get 7 in any rubrics
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload
Just read the cases carefully

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: LABU 2040
reviews.comment_content:
I forget the % already, that’s why the sum is not 100%
1. Group Presentation(case 1) (20%) + peer evaluation (2.5%)
2. Group Presentation(case 2) (25%) + peer evaluation (2.5%)
The requirement of case 1 and 2 is the same. If Nick is your tutor, please finish the whole thing and let him revise the whole thing for you. Ask as many questions as you can(to pretend you want to make it perfect). He will give instructions to you. Please directly follow his instruction.(Don’t waste time to ask why, all LABU tutors are 吹毛求疵) He is the one who marks your work.

For this semester, you are required to do a recording and post on youtube. That means you have infinite NG and you do not need to memorize. Simply set a monitor and show the whole script behind the camera. Just read aloud.

3. Report (case 2) (35%)  (individual)
Write a recommendation report in 1000 words. He gives specific requirements. Also please read Canvas. Instructions are written clearly. Please remember to consult him and follow his comments. (I don’t do this because at that time already announced for P/F option)
4. Class Participation (10%)
Finish 2 online quiz(infinite trial) and 2 mini assignment.
Of course class participation is important. The only way is to speak and not to be quiet. (I don’t do any extra thing after P/F, and skip one online quiz and one mini assignment, and even skip one class intentionally to skip the mini presentation)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Normal, not chur
Please entertain the tutor. Don’t give him dead air.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite leng
Group presentation 1: 5555
Group presentation 2: 6666
Writing: 555 (don’t expect too much, I spent less than 1.5 hours to finish it with P/F option)
Grade: high B+, near to A-  (actually for me it is P)

Remember the secret of your LABU grade depends on the multiplier of your tutor. Same marks by different tutors gives you different grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
LABU is chur as always. But try to follow instructions and suggestions of Nick. Hea do any extra task (but need to do it!)

Higher workload than LABU 2060 (I take them in the same semester)

reviews.author: UNeedJesus
reviews.title: If you see an English native speaker YOU BETTER RUN
reviews.comment_content: Simple straightforward presentation skills, including body language, lexicon for certain contexts, verbal/tone when speaking etc. Most of the classes are just brainstorming and practicing problem solving for various case studies. Just use your common sense and simple business knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For the most part the teaching is very much understandable and straightforward, and frankly quite relaxing. However sometimes the comments/feedbacks on how to improve your body language are just ridiculous/vague (move your fingers? Spread them open? Move them closer?)

The brainstorming sessions on how to solve certain issues or dissecting a case are sometimes hit or miss. Sometimes she wants a very specific solution/answer, but as we all know there are definitely more than one answers for certain problems right? So she just goes about the class asking each group a question, just waiting for this one specific word.

Oh and what drives me nuts is how brand/image is somehow different? Come on it's more or less interchangeable. Just how she teaches or guides students to a certain specific solution for a case study is very frustrating.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't want to come off as salty, but I feel Nora's grading is a tad biased. I personally believe my presentation skills are pretty decent, natural and I look confident/persuasive. But I swear she gives the try=hards a better grading, even though their solution is just as full of shit as everyone else's, and their presentation skill/English isn't all that great. It is especially tough to stand out on the curve when everyone else are native speakers too, and within the add-drop period there have been so many that drop cuz they just can't match the level of English. So be careful.

Oh and like most soft-skill classes instead of exams that test hard-knowledge, grading is subjective. Even though your solution is valid (and honestly every bloody consulting solution that uni students come up with is vague as fuck anyways), she might not like it or it isn't the specific one she had in mind and therefore your grade drops cuz the application/solution "doesn't work" in her mind.
reviews.comment_workload:
Absolutely easy to handle for those whose mother tongue is English. Just got a couple of short reports and drafts/practice presentations/scripts.

Honestly you can get by with just skim reading case studies for the practice ones at the start-mid of semester.

reviews.author: shur
reviews.comment_content:
One mini case and two cases
Presentation, business case analysis skills
Cases are about family businesses, intercultural communication & management
reviews.comment_teaching: Nora is a really nice instructor. She explains the materials very clearly and can make the class atmosphere light. She always replies to emails (very quickly) and answers all our questions even about the content of our presentation/report. She remembers names and stories of the people in her class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.
As long as you try and consult with Nora, it's not hard to get Very Good/Excellent.

Attendance is taken from quizzes (because it was fully online)
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost 90% of the work in this class is groupwork
A lot of meetings
Have to make progress for (almost) every session
Just hope that your groupmates are not freeriding, it can be really tough if they do so!

reviews.author: asdfghjkl
reviews.comment_content: boring thing (presentation and report writing skills)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is quite funny, always trying to lighten up the atmosphere (his laughing point is very low lol)
I think because of online teaching, it makes it hard to interact with other students, so sometimes you can see his face becomes a bit west (or looks frustrated)
Personally, I dun find this course useful so I have no problems with his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Make sure that you follow Ivan's advice (our group got lost so fucked up the case analysis)
This sem I feel like the grading is better than my expectation. Cuz it's online teaching, I dun have mood to study, so I 9 do, but ends up having B range. (avg 5)
reviews.comment_workload:
2 case studies (presetation--taking video)
1 report (1000words)
Actually the workload is not that heavy, if your groups have decided the suggestions, then everything will be fine.
if you are not a toxic jj like me, having sources will make your life easier, I think the cases are same, you can coursehero see sth similar.

reviews.author: Flame
reviews.comment_content: Essentially, the course is about analyzing and preparing a presentation for a case study. You will go through the steps of analyzing the case study for the root problems before preparing a group presentation on the situation and the solutions. You will also practice presentation and report writing skills.
reviews.comment_teaching:
My instructor was quite to the point, and essentially covered the case analysis steps, report writing requirements, and presentation skills in a concise manner.

However, for this kind of course, doing more practice on your own for the above three would be more beneficial for your confidence for the graded items.
reviews.comment_grading:
The only issue is that we don't get to see the distribution of the grades or how exactly we are graded.

Attendance (5% of final grade)
2 major case studies:

Case 1 (35% of final grade)
1. Presentation (20% of total grade)
- Task completion (30%): focused and effective recommendations
- Organization and teamwork (20%): presentation-wise; orderly and consistent slides, transitions
- Delivery (25%): your presentation skills
- Language (25%): presentation skills, but also audience awareness and tuning your word choice as needed

2. Written report (15% of total grade): with some of the sections
- Task completion and organization (50%): following the format, being clear and concise in presenting and analyzing the problems and solutions
- Language (50%): word choice for the audience

Case 2 (60% of final grade)
1. Presentation (25% of total grade)
- Task completion (30%)
- Organization and teamwork (20%)
- Delivery (25%)
- Language (25%)
2. Peer evaluation (5% of total grade): assessing yourself and your teammates on performance as team members for the oral presentation
3. Recommendation report (30% of total grade)
- Task completion (30%)
- Organization (35%)
- Language (35%)
reviews.comment_workload: The overall workload is not large. You will have 2 major case studies for which you will do a presentation and a written report. If your whole team is diligent, all of you will have about the same workload in terms of the case analysis and preparing the presentation slides. The amount of practice each person needs for the presentation and writing the report will vary on the individual's presentation and writing skills.

reviews.author: lwk0403
reviews.comment_content: Two business cases, both involves presentation and writing
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick actually teaches well. You can see his effort trying to engage students in the class. He also gives out good suggestions.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is terrible. The mean is so high. I got the same grade with my friend while he had an average lower range in most criteria than me.
reviews.comment_workload:
Huge workload. Especially if you meet poor group mates.
The workload in the second case is even worse. Since UST switched to an online teaching mode, professor could not even finish teaching but could only provide consultations. It feels like having to finish everything without even learning something new.

reviews.author: lc09
reviews.title: The best instructor in LABU2040!
reviews.comment_content:
Case 1
- Presentation (On problem and solution) - 20%
- Writing (Only the solution) - 15%

Case 2
- Presentation (Problem, solution with Q&A) - 25%
- Writing (Whole report with problem + solution) - 30%
- Peer evaluation - 5%

Overall participation - 5%


The amount of assessment is quite high and the presentation will take you a lot time if you treat it seriously. However, the writing is based on your content in presentation so it will be easy if you have a good content in presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is so chill and he has his own powerpoint with main points clearly marked on it. He encourages everyone to discuss during the lesson, and provides his insight and feedback.

The feedback from him is basically what he expects in the presentation and writing, so make sure you follow it. He also emphasize feasibility and logic of your idea, and your body language and hand gesture during the presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade.

Presentation 1: 6+5.5+6+6.5
Writing 1: 6+5.5

Other scores not given
Final grade: A



Ivan's grading is fair (much better than other tutor!!) and he will give detailed guidelines for how he would judge your performance. After the first presentation and writing, he would provide detailed feedback on why he will give you that particular score, which is fair and transparent.

To score high, you must be a little bit more proactive in class. Be the one who initiate discussions in class. Also, listen and follow Ivan's feedback would guarantee you a very good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The 2 group projects really require lots of time to finish, especially when your idea is criticized by Ivan and you need to rewrite the whole idea...

However, if you follow his feedback and revise your idea, he will definitely give you a good grade. You would also need to practice and recite your script fluently as your delivery and presentation skills are even more important than your content. Good group mates are important also as it will help you a lot in brainstorming ideas and preparing presentation.

reviews.author: Tyhxd
reviews.title: This course is better than what I expect with Nick as the tutor.
reviews.comment_content: The content that this course contains is quite interesting as it is basically teaching two business cases and other oral/presentation skills throughout the semester. The business cases are easy to understand and thus the portion of the content is mainly focused on oral and presentation skills, plus working with your team members on the case.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is the best tutor ever encountered. He is funny and not harsh in both his teaching and as a person even though he claims his grading is harsher than normal. He takes teaching very serious but at the same time love to interact with students.
reviews.comment_grading: As mentioned before Nick claims his grading is harsher compared to other tutors but I think it's pretty fair and better than what he claims. i do not think that he is a "grade killer" that he jokes he is at the beginning of the semester.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is average. You have to submit two individual reports on those two business cases. Two presentations are also required for you and your team on that two cases. Attendance is required due to the requirement of the school and an absence of more than 4 lessons will directly give you a fail. However there will be no exams as the readings of the business cases kind of replaced them.

reviews.author: lokhall3
reviews.comment_content: A passionate instructor but castle in the air . With detailed explain on marking scheme but personally did not find much way to improve my English level indeed. Willing to give feedback , once i sent a email to seek for advice and i receive a nearly 500 words feedback.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite rely on powerpoint , no relationship with interesting but not a stressful learning environment . Fair amount of discussion and Q&A , activities are mostly base on the required syllabus .
reviews.comment_grading:
It is completely a disaster , i believe not much local can fulfil her tough standard. You will find that most of your class can only receive a competent or a satisfactory given a fair english standard. In my opinion , she is too harsh even for those have a excellent english background.

She mentioned attendance is not part of the grading, i do think so , just don't miss over 5 lessons.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload as a labu course . 2 Presentations and 2 essays . Do take time but not really a difficult job.

reviews.author: smile:)
reviews.comment_content:
standard labu
two cases
reviews.comment_teaching:
Overall class mood is serious.
Good spoken English and local.

Give response if you want him to teach with more energy.
just say the answer will do, dont be afriad.
he really waits for the answer and then awkward silence...... (he will call out names too, so pay attention)

He will give out mini hw, like ask you to prepare for the class, as class participation counts so do it


You can ask him any question you have and he will answer you promptly.

need to be proactive to ask for opinions regarding your solutions for your final report as he won't give comments the quality of your solution after presentation. Else, you don't really know whether he thinks it's okay or not.
reviews.comment_grading:
(Full mark is 7)
First presentation: 5677
*first two numbers are group and last two numbers are individual marks
report: 677

second case didnt release anything

I attended all lessons (can miss up to 5 classes)

final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Labu2040 is heavy workload itself.
Depends on your goal, standard and group mates.
you need to do powerpoint, presentation and individual report.

good luck in having good group mates haha, else it's just fine, take the lead and control the quality, tho it means you have much more work.

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.comment_content:
The course is based on two case studies:
Case 1: West Indies Yacht Club Resort
About motivation issues, staff turnover and lazy staff

Case 2: Kitchen Best
About unethical business practices

You study 2 mini cases in the Add/Drop period and the main cases start after the Add/Drop deadline. The assessment for each case is 1 group presentation and 1 individual recommendation report. The groups are made by the instructor and students don't get to choose their groupmates.

This is course is mainly about choosing your words and style carefully. The level of business case analysis is actually pretty low.

There's an attendance requirement and missing >5 classes gets you an F
reviews.comment_teaching:
Susanna made the class pretty interactive and focused significantly on understanding the audience's perspective. But, she puts way too much importance on the nitty-gritties and its quite difficult to understand what she wants exactly.

Make sure you ask lots of meaningful questions, doing that will not only get you a good participation grade, but also you'll end up extracting more information and important details about the assessments which she doesn't give out at the beginning.

She is easy to approach in-class but doesn't give much individual consultation time because she teaches a lot of classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Presentation (Case 1)
20% Written Report (Case 1)
25% Presentation (Case 2)
25% Written Report (Case 2)
5% Peer evaluation (For Case 2 presentation)
5% Attendance and class participation

For me:
Presentation (Case 1): 5555
Written Report (Case 1): 656
Presentation (Case 2): 6666
Written Report (Case 2): 777

Final grade: A–

Susanna gives out pretty bad grades for the first 2 assessments and >80% of my class got the same grade for all criteria in the first presentation. However, my friends who got higher assessment grades with other professors ended with similar or worse final grades than me.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course (especially with Susanna) is pretty high. It doesn't sound much on paper but the presentations (though just 12 min long) and the reports (just 1000 words) require a lot of careful attention to have a shot at a good grade.

For international students:
Since you don't get to choose your presentation groups, you'll end up being the only non-local in your group. Most locals have a pretty shitty English fluency (no offence) and you'll need to put in some extra effort to make sure what they're saying actually makes sense (50% of the presentation grade is a group grade). My groupmates were nice people so they tried their best to not revert to Cantonese, but this can happen with others.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content: The content is actually quite useless. Just case studies and then do presentations and write recommendation reports. Not much can really learn. Maybe some presentation skills and powerpoint making skills.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessie is very patient in answering questions. You can ask as many questions as you can and she won't get annoyed. You can even make a 1 to 1 appointment with her and she will explain the details and area for improvement to you.

HOWEVER, women are always unpredictable. She shifted her mind very fast. She just suggested us to do A, then when we followed what she suggested, and she commented doing B was better than A. Come on, then why did you tell us to do A at first??????
reviews.comment_grading:
Hmm.... ok grading lah. She is really tight in giving grades. She has really high expectation, especially on content. She expects you to mention EVERYTHING, EVERY DETAIL within 12 minutes.

Grading Components:
20% Presentation 1: 5755
20% Report 1: 455
25% Presentation 2: 4555
25% Report 2: 665
5% Peer Evaluation: unknown
5% Class Participation: unknown

Final Grade: B

I don't know if this is called good grade or not. You should judge it by yourslef.
reviews.comment_workload:
Wow. Heavy workload bruhh....

She has 2 mini presentations before the real presentation. So, you need to prepare earlier. And if you do not prepare well, you will just waste the mini presentations as she will give tons of suggestions.

Jessie allows swaping of group members in Presentation 1, but not Presentation 2. If you have a good team, the workload is super fine. Unfortunately, I got one poor team member in my 2nd presentation and her part just screwed up the whole presentation.

Report is also challenging. You have to include all the problems and solutions in 1000 words. If you cut some details just for not exceeding the limit, then Jessie will give you a low score in content.

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.comment_content:
Two mini-cases before add-drop deadline and two big cases after it.
The big cases:
1. West Indies Yacht Club Resort - When Cultures Collide
2. Kitchen Best - Ethics When Doing Cross-Boundary Business in Southern China
Should be the same for every semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Encourages class participation quite a lot, but her perspective on the cases was a bit peculiar... probably because she came from an English Literature background. And she sometimes mixed up details in the cases. But she was quite nice and cared about us.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Presentation (Case 1)
20% Written Report (Case 1)
25% Presentation (Case 2)
25% Written Report (Case 2)
5% Peer evaluation (only in case 2)
5% Attendance and class participation (make sure you don't miss more than 5 classes or you'll receive an F)

For the presentations and written reports, everyone's marks are very similar so I think what distinguishes you from the others is class participation. Make sure you speak up in class.

For me:
Presentation (Case 1): 4555
Written Report (Case 1): 565
Presentation (Case 2): 6666
Written Report (Case 2): Not released

Turns out it's a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy during the preparation for the presentations. A bit lighter when it comes to the written reports as you can copy some contents from your presentations.

Also, as you need to actively participate during class to let the instructor recognizes you, better read the case thoroughly beforehand. This may take you some extra time but it's worth it.

reviews.author: EricKan
reviews.title: 18-19 Fall Labu2040 reveiw
reviews.comment_content: Throughout the semester, we were taught the basic skills of business case analysis. It was quite a good experience for those who haven't joined any case study before. You can have a better understanding of how to solve problems persuasively and professionally through analyzing business cases and presenting solutions to problems identified.
reviews.comment_teaching:
May is helpful and willing to answer your question.

Yeah that's all...
reviews.comment_grading:
I was taught by May Liao but I don't know why I can't find her name in the list above.
Anyway, Labu 2040 has been well known for its poor grading. And May is not a good grade tutor at all. So my own recommendation is :
If you speak well in English, don't hesitate to reg her. She prefers students who speak fluently.
If you don't, then don't reg her.
reviews.comment_workload:
There were two business cases in total, each contained a presentation and a report afterward. We were assigned into groups of 3 to handle the cases together.
I think those cases may be a little bit difficult for some people who have never participated in any case competition. But still, you will have enough help from both the tutor and peers.
Just relax and pray that you won't have free riders in your group.

And I suggest that you should try to get sources of the reports, it can help you a lot doubtlessly.

reviews.author: ppppp
reviews.comment_content:
Case analysis skills.
Presentation:
-how a good powerpoint looks like
-how a good presenter acts like
Report:
-basic components
-tone, format etc...
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick's lessons are not boring at all. He uses course material thoroughly and teaches us useful skills and techniques to fulfil his requirements. He will guide us to analyse the case step by step through assigning short tasks in class so that we can get some insights to complete our projects. He is super helpful and friendly even in consultation part pointing out our mistakes and practising with us together.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair.
Case one (presentation+report): 30~40%
Case two (presentation+report): 50~60%
Peer evaluation (only on case two): remaining
Can't remember the actual number but peer evaluation can contribute to a sub grade (so you must not freeride your groupmates in case two!)
The only difference between case one and case two in grading is that visual aids and Q&A are only assessed in case two but not case one.
Participation matters but Nick still gives you good grades even though you skip quite a lot lessons (maximum is 6)
But he rather expects high in delivery, that your moves, hand gestures and eye contact really contribute to your final score.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 cases in total. Both require group presentation and individual report.
For case one, visual aids and Q&A are not assessed so it will be a bit easier than the second case as you don't need to do any preparation for them.
Reports are submitted after the presentation, so you can use your own ideas or those from the other groups.
Generally, workload depends on whether you have supportive groupmates or not!

reviews.author: Evalsk
reviews.comment_content:
Not bad. Just like normal lang courses
He will provide ebook to you at the beginning of the term. You can refer to it in lesson or at home while doing your task. So it is easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice and funny. At least not a boring class. Not sure if it is an accident, there were many non-locals in my class
reviews.comment_grading:
Better than i expected.
He concerns class attention so better to attend all classes. He usually let us go early.
reviews.comment_workload: Two minicases as introduction. then two big cases. One speaking task and one writing task per big case. It is quite heavy indeed

reviews.author: Studdas
reviews.title: Good Course to take
reviews.comment_content:
Content is pretty chill.
2 mini cases which are discussed in class.
2 long cases which are graded. - The class is split into random groups and you have to prepare a presentation including solutions and recommendations to solve the issues described in the case.
After that, a recommendation report has to be uploaded via turn it in.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nick is a really peaceful instructor. He explains concepts through interesting examples and interacts with the entire class. You can message him whenever you have a doubt and he will always take out the time to meet you.
Attendance is the same for any language course. you require around 80% and if you miss 5 classes you have to retake the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
He might be labelled as a Killer. He told us that only 20% of the class gets an A range which is basically 4 people in the class.
He pays attention to almost everything in your group presentation (the way you walk, hand gestures, pronunciation, speed etc)
Oral presentation- 1
20%
Oral presentation 2- 25%
Writing task 1 -20%
Writing task 2 -25%
Peer evaluation- 5%
Participation* -5%
* - this is usually in class activities
If you attend most of the classes and pay attention to what he says in the consultations you will get a good grade.
I was above mean in 3/4 assignments and got an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is average.
This includes reading the 20 page long courses and preparing for the presentations and recommendation reports

reviews.author: uston99

reviews.author: Stellaaaa
reviews.comment_content:
Fairly interesting contents, would be very helpful for someone who wants to be a consultant. The two cases discussed in classes are highly related in real life.

In both cases, you are in a  group of 3 or 4, and as consultants of a company, trying to help another company in trouble. Each cases have around 20 pages reading materials so that you know what is going on.

I have actually developed my interest in consulting from this class, so... yea I think it's worth taking!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Love his english accents! I personally enjoy his lessons a lot.
Also, his lessons are not boring as it's quite interactive.
reviews.comment_grading:
B- in the end, thought I did better than that! Spent a lot of time preparing for presentations... But I guess my reports weren't that good...

2 presentations and 2 reports, and I think he also takes attendance in classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Highly suggest everyone to start reports earlier... and of course, put in more time and efforts for the presentation.

Overall, I don't think the workload is bad, I only spend a lot of time in this class when it comes to times of presentation and the reports followed by, other than that, only reading materials, which could be fun reading!

reviews.author: hustleaf
reviews.title: 少chur但係學到野
reviews.comment_content: Content provided by the course itself is too outdated, and the two cases are not realistic at all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Levi is enthusiastic and funny, he always interacts and shares his stories in class. Although he can be acutely criticising and chur lol, you can learn from him. Don't feel bad if he picks on your ideas, because he is trying to help by guiding you to polish the recommendations.
For most lessons, we need to use the framework thing (his guidelines sort of) and analyse the cases which actually benefits us in planning for the assignments!
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair Grading

I was quite responsive during the class (answer questions sometimes)

Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Small amount of work, just two main cases (2 reports and 2 presentations in total) and two mini cases as the warm-up exercises, but the schedule worsened the whole thing which we were given extremely limited time for the second report.

reviews.author: Charlton
reviews.title: A fruitful course
reviews.comment_content: This course can provide a chance for us to practise our thinking process and presentational skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is humorous and he can always point out the main problem of your presentation. Really a great learning experience to learn from Nick.
reviews.comment_grading: Please make sure you don't skip too many lectures as the attendance would be important. However, as long as you show your improvement and follow the instructions, it's not difficult to get a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much except the preparation of the group presaention which really depends on the progress of your own group.

reviews.author: Jackie0925

reviews.comment_grading:
very poor grading!!!!

with many 5s and very little 4s
only get a C+
VERY POOR GRADING!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely high. Many reports and presentations. Really tired when studying this course. This course was like a 6-credit course

reviews.author: sww
reviews.title: 比想象中爛grade
reviews.comment_content:
個course分爲兩個大cases，但add drop period時已經有兩個mini cases討論，主要講下閒公司有咩問題，underlying causes，stakeholders，然後就根據呢d問題提出recommendations。

每個case都會分組做presentation，然後individual recommendation report，每個case會用三至四堂講曬d recommendations既points，所以基本上個個d point黎黎去去都係果幾個，係組組既point都差唔多既程況下就好睇你本身英文既底子同presentation skills。
reviews.comment_teaching:
May Liao上堂既流程堂堂都一樣，首先係上一堂既review，跟住開始講case，會準備問題討論，然後就抽人答問題，最後就會係全組討論環節，可能係白板寫低討論結果跟住present。如果對個case準備不足或者本身唔中意答問題/present就會有d麻煩，不過黎黎去去都係果幾個人比反應她。

不過不得不承認May Liao係個靚女，衣著有taste，英文講的好好聼，所以聼她教書係賞心悅目既，如果唔chur人答問題會更好。·
reviews.comment_grading:
上面提到may liao係靚女，不過越靚女就越爛grade。她要求好高，比d comment也很mean，普遍分係4-6/7，最多人拿5，無人拿到7，就算有6都好點都整個5比你。計分如下：
Case 1：Group presentation（分individual part同group）
               Individual report
Case 2：Group presentation（分individual part同group，ppt計分）
               Individual report
Attendance

Labu係爛grade既course，所以不可以用lang1002/1003既grading衡量，比分十分緊手，有時候跟足她既要求寫她都會比黑人問號你，所以有時都唔知她想點，就算有4有5，5多過4都係拿c/c+，不過如果你上堂經常答問題，她可能就會對你好點哦
reviews.comment_workload: 還算好，不算太重workload，上堂方式同lang大同小異，比lang chur少少，可能得閑叫你黎個即興present或者今堂講下堂就present，得一日準備。不過除左呢d都無assignment同exam。

reviews.author: chlkaren
reviews.title: Keep your expectations low

Two case studies.
1. West Indies Yacht Club Resort (about resolving cultural differences)
2. Kitchen Best (about Bribery and unethical business practices)

Kathy gives you directions and advice on what and how to write your essays.
Yet, the course doesn't hone your presentation skills. You just gotta follow the performance descriptors and try to do what was required.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just keep your expectations low.
1st speaking: 6655
1st writing: 555
2nd speaking: 6555
2nd writing: unknown

Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Only two presentations and two essays throughout the semester. Yet, the course was demanding as you won't have much time to prepare for each assessment. Normally, you have to start working on the essays right after you finished the presentations.

reviews.author: VincentKB

good grade, not a killer.

most of my friends and group mates  got A range.

reviews.author: Jinsenjinny
reviews.comment_content:
Several Mini Cases to get used to the business cases and before starting the actual ones. .
2 business case analysis. One during mid-term season and one before final
-2 Reports
-2 Presentations
reviews.comment_teaching: His style is pretty interactive. Lots of questions asked towards the class in order to make the students more engaging and learning.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grader i would say. He pays a lot of attention to details so that is why some may label him as a killer. He has high standards and would grade according to your capacity and performances in your presentation of the 2 cases.
reviews.comment_workload: Class is chill. Not much workload except a lot of classwork. Groups are usually formed to share opinions, ideas and work towards the business cases. He often urges students to speak up and share to the class.

reviews.author: Gevin
reviews.title: Good Teacher!
reviews.comment_content: In the beginning, there are 4 mini cases to help student polish their skills in dealing with business cases, for instance, identifying symptoms, root causes, and solutions. Throughout the course, you will be assessed by writing a report as well as oral presentation. For the first report and presentation, the percentage will be smaller as to help you improve for the final ones. Through this course you will learn that your typical type of academic writing will not be able to be implemented as business case report.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very assertive and friendly. He speaks and gives clear instructions in class. He also maintains an interactive atmosphere in the class. You need to make sure that you are quite interactive in the class since it is really beneficial in supporting your final letter grade. He also gives very detailed and specific feedback on how to improve your tasks towards the final ones.
reviews.comment_grading:
Like all language courses, attendance is compulsory. You need to attend 80% of the sessions. Attendance also includes being active in class or sort. It accounts for 10% of the final grade.
Written report case 1: 20%
Oral presentation case 1: 20%
Written report case 2: 25%
Oral presentation case 2: 25%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload actually depends on how you are determined to get good grades! It is quite a lot of work if you do all the task and homework as instructed, but if you want to fulfill only the requirements, it only consists of two oral presentations as well as the two written reports. The rest is not really graded, but it is also a good chance to show how you participate and dedicated to the class, to get more attendance percentage.

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.title: Good course, good company, good grade
reviews.comment_content:
LABU 2040 is a highly interactive course where you will make new friends and enjoy many benefits of learning in an engaging class environment.
You will complete a series of individual and group tasks that are designed to increase your skills in case analyses. You will improve your ability to read cases efficiently and discuss them effectively.

LABU 2040 focuses on developing the many skills involved in analyzing business cases and successfully communicating your ideas in a business context.

LABU 2040 is a graded, one-semester course worth three credits. The course focuses on five main elements.
a. Mini business cases
b. Oral communication for business
c. Business case 1
d. Written communication for business
e. Business case 2
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is the best teacher I've met in UST. he's engaging, funny, dresses well, entertaining, gives free snacks in class, etc etc like ur typical gay best friend
He teaches well, gives good feedbacks, likes it if people speak up in class (be sure to bring up good discussion points too)
The first half of the course is hella chill
Towards the end of the course, he wont give much guidance and we are expected to find our own resources for developing and improving our presentation & report
reviews.comment_grading:
For presentation and report writing task, the grading system used is:
- Excellent
- Very good
- Competent
- Satisfactory
- Marginal
- Unsatisfactory

Assessed Presentation 1
The class average scores are:
·      Task Completion & Organisation – Competent (COMP)
·       Delivery & Language – Between Satisfactory (SAT) and Competent (COMP)

A range secured if you ace the report writing and do okay in the presentations + active member of the class
reviews.comment_workload:
Oral presentation 1 20%
Oral presentation 2 25%
Writing task 1 20%
Writing task 2 25%
Peer evaluation 5%
Participation* 5%

Tbh heavy workload if you have shitty groupmates
Answers for case study can be discussed with other groups, found in the internet, or you can ask for ur seniors who took this course already since cases arent changed

reviews.author: chy
reviews.title: good grade good course
reviews.comment_content:
This course provides chances for you to study business cases surrounding different topics. In each case study, you are required to form into groups and discuss in every details provided. Coming up with ideas on how to solve the problems stated in the case, formal presentations and recommendation reports have to be submitted and presented.
LABU 2040  requires online course book instead of buying a physical textbook like Lang classes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is the best tutor I have ever met.
He is really nice, willing to get super close with students.
Lessons were fun since he will involve students in group discussions and also sharing crazy ideas.
Ivan is willing to guide you though the case studies and usually if you follow his suggestions, you will be doing good in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
overall this course has good grades as long as you are paying effort into the assignments and presentations
class participation is also important as you have to impress your tutor
reviews.comment_workload: This course originally has a lot of presentations and assignments. The workload is comparatively heavier than other courses.

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰

成個course基本上唔係教你點analyse case

有人話佢剩係關心班上面一部份同學
呢個係真

reviews.author: tim1108
reviews.title: Great Class
reviews.comment_content: Through case study, you are basically able to identify problems and corresponding root cause in the situation. Also you will know how to have a formal presentation and draft a recommendation report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is a funny and responsible person. He makes those boring and simple knowledge be interesting. He try his best to motivate everyone to learn by using some odd example. He brings a good atmosphere in class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is objective and not biased.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just simply two group presentations and two individual written recommendation reports.
Workload is acceptable since nick will skip and shorten those meaningless stuff and preparation work.

reviews.author: perbo
reviews.comment_content: Business case analysis, writing and oral skills, presentation skills. Was given several cases to analyse.
reviews.comment_teaching: Taught by group projects/discussions, presentations. Very interactive classes.
reviews.comment_grading: If you put in effort, and has good English speaking and writing skills, you should be able to do well in this course. Make sure you participate in class and answer some questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Light in the beginning, sometimes have some simple writing tasks. Quite heavy towards the end of the semester when we had to prepare for our case presentations, but the process was fun.

reviews.author: T123
reviews.comment_content: This course is all about understanding and solving business cases. To begin with, there are four mini cases to help students understand how to deal with these cases (to identify the problems, the root causes and finally solutions to solve them). Then, since the course is also to help improve your writing and presentation skills, classes turn to building oral presentation and report writing skills. Finally there are two where you deliver a presentation along with a recommendation report.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is great, he is very friendly. He speaks fluently and clearly in class. Since the class is very small, they are very interactive, so make sure you answer his questions which will also give a better impression. After each presentation he gives very clear advice on how you can improve so you know what to do for the final presentations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance is a key part of the grading, you have to attend at least 80% of the course. Aside from that you have to answer questions in class.
Attendance 10%
Case 1 - Presentation 20%
Case 1 - Report 20%
Case 2 - Presentation 25%
Case 2 - Report 25%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload can be light or heavy depending on your groupmates for the presentation. The workload is pretty decent though, as there are only two assessed presentations and reports, the others are just for practice so they are not graded but you should still try as it will give a better impression.

reviews.author: Anitha
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very interesting but you must read a lot of cases and try to read in-between the lines to understand them properly. The cases very long so you will have to spend an hour reading each of them.

-No final exam
-2 Presentations
-2 written case analysis
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good but you must attend almost all the classes to understand the cases given to you. The instructor spends a lot of time explaining how to comprehend the layers of analysis in each case. The instructor will also explain how to present yourself in front of the audience during your presentation.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good as long as your instructor can see an improvement in you from the first presentation to the last presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: The work load is high because it is mostly group-work but if you did IB in high school then it must be easier for you. This is because you would have already been exposed to many tight deadlines so handling the stress will be easier for you.

reviews.author: a210t
reviews.title: LABU 2040
reviews.comment_content: The course content is relevant to real life and teaches students how to give formal, business presentations. Also focuses on case study analyses and promotes working in a group.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is easy-going and creates a comfortable and encouraging learning environment. He gives positive feedback and is available outside of the classroom to help you in case you have doubts.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is average and easy to manage as long as you do not procrastinate. It does not take up much time if you finish your work on time

reviews.author: vincent_chandra
reviews.title: LABU 2040
reviews.comment_content: Content is relevant to real life circumstances and course teaches you how to apply business skills and knowledge to these cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher often gives constructive feedbacks and are willing to spare time with those who want additional suggestions by meeting him out of class hours. He has a great teaching style by incorporating fun and seriousness to the course. Overall, amazing teacher.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair to everyone. However, if you want to get better grades, it is recommended that you work extra hard and meet him outside of class to ask him about your stance and spaces for improvement.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload generally can be handled. We just have to do a follow up written assignment based on in-class exercises and at times do a short presentation about the topic currently discussed.

reviews.author: lmacchch
reviews.title: 多谢tess

我们堂挺好龟的

reviews.comment_workload: 其实还好 就是pre3前有点chur

reviews.author: CCM_T13
reviews.title: A passionate tutor in a course with bad structure
reviews.comment_content: 2 main case studies, West Indies Yacht Club Resort and Kitchen Best Appliances. Presentation is required in both cases. It depends a lot on the packaging of the group's ideas. It kicks off with two mini-cases to show how things are done in the LABU way. It's all about finding the problems of companies and brainstorming ways to improve the situation, just like consultants. Having some passionate teammates is needed and I'm more than lucky to find them. It's randomly assigned so you guys might wanna find at least a dozen reliable friends to register for the same class. If you are lucky enough, then you may even find some new friends in this course and study together. (I found some local friends for lunch reunions this semester.)
reviews.comment_teaching: He's kind and funny af. Sometimes he got jokes and made us laugh a bit. As an outgoing person, he often laughs at me in class and I really don't mind. (If you are an INTROVERT who doesn't like a bit of mocking, then you really need to step up to tell Levi to stop, I REALLY MEAN IT.) This makes our class less stressful despite the demanding workload. He cares a lot about our class. He had a lot of group consultations in breakout sessions and guided us throughout class time. Through his guidance, a clearer picture of the group project could be seen. Get a lot of guidance when needed. Passionate and helpful overall. Btw he's local, and I was caught speaking Cantonese during breakout sessions, just fyi.
reviews.comment_grading:
Oral presentation 1 (12min): 20%
Peer evaluation for presentation 1: 5%
Individual report 1 (within 1000 words): 30%
Oral presentation 2 (12min + 4min Q&A): 30%
Peer evaluation 2: 5%
Online assignments: 2% (finish in class, just MCs)
Learning portfolio: 8% (talk about what you've learned in this course)
Just remember to fulfill the 80% attendance in order not to get an F.
Marks are harsh but the grade isn't. No midterms and final exams. Got an A-
reviews.comment_workload: I know it's not Levi's fault, but the workload is quite large. About 1 deadline a week and it may be something like a presentation paragraph draft with a neat explanation. If things are not done, the coming deadline will come back to haunt. Some deadlines are not graded but you better follow the schedule, otherwise, you can bring nothing up in consultation and receive no feedback.

reviews.author: TBA
reviews.title: Easy if you are good at presentations
reviews.comment_content: So the course basically deals with 2 business cases and you need to give a presentation to both of them which are the major aspect for your grade. But chill it is easy because it is a group work. It will be even more easier if you are an extrovert like me.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is one of the kindest teachers I have met at ust so far!  One week before our presentations there were no classes as she wanted to give us enough time for our preparation (other sections haven't had this advantage) but she still manages to stick to the syllabus and the time plan.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading so don't worry about potential crazy smart people in your course. You will receive feedback in terms of "Excellent", very good, good etc.
reviews.comment_workload: This was the easiest course at UST I have taken so far and it required the lowest workload. (but as I said I am an extrovert person and got along with my tremendous groupmates) but I am sure if you are not happy with your group there is the option to beg the instructor to switch the group.

reviews.author: salmonfish

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.author: why am I here
reviews.title: Not too bad after all (only for grading, other things suck)
reviews.comment_content:
I think the content is quite interesting though (only if the content is for a talk or something)
It has 2 cases to study.
This semester, one about a resort in the British Virgin Island and the second one about a kitchen appliances company in China.
Each of them is extremely long and many of things to care for. You really need to think of the culture of doing business, the personality of the people in different countries and the situation of different companies. It not too hard but really annoying.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think Levi is really a good instrutors. He is really passionate in picking every mistakes out and make you want to die when he is giving comments. Every consultation is like a nightmare and you really need to be well-prepared in advance. Otherwise, you will just become a dumb.
He provided many consultation for us which is quite a good thing to do before handing in your work. He provided consultation of the report as well and he will really read the things you have at that moment. Quite a nice guy but just need to be careful for everything you write or say in the report or presentation as he will pick on every single word!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was quite good actually.
Even though many comments in UST Space said that he is a killer, I don't think so after I received my grade.
During the course, you might be sad when you look at the scores but the grading is quite good actually. I think he is quite tight in scores but loose in grades.
(While there are some instructors which gives you a high score but a poor grade.)
reviews.comment_workload:
3 presentations in total
1 for minicase
1 for case 1
1 for case 2
The first two can be done by filming videos
The last one needs to be done in Zoom
and 1 report (no more than 1000)
Needs a lot of time to discuss everything with your groupmates and it's quite time-consuming. But you don't have a choice as this is a compulsory course for SBM students
Really depends on you groupmate. Some of my groupmate made up sources and almost drove me crazy while writing the report. Levi used Zoom to randomly split the whole class into groups. So if you are lucky, you will have brilliant groupmates or vice versa. So good luck you guys!

reviews.author: Daisychun32

reviews.comment_workload: It is fair, no hw. Only 2 group present and 2 report. One learning portfolio. Case study is like that

reviews.author: jjjj
reviews.comment_content: Mainly 2 cases. One is about staff efficiency issue and the other is about corruption within a family business.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ivan's teaching is great. He prepares his own powerpoint that provides great help to the report writing and the presentation. He is also very helpful, kind and easy to approach. He also creates a very supportive learning environment and encourages everyone to help each other. He also provides good feedback and we get our assignment back with grading very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say his grading is fair. I screw up the first presentation because of my group members. But I did well on the report-writing so I guess that kind of evens out. For the first presentation, only the content is graded. However, Ivan could be picky with your body language and even where you stand.
For the second presentation, there will also be a Q&A at the end that will be graded and the PPT slides will also be graded.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is okay. For each case you will need to hand in a report and presentation. The report is individual and the presentation will be in group.
The workload will be largely dependent on who you get in your group. If you get smart people, then the presentation will be a breeze but if not, the presentation will be a pain in the ass.
