reviews.author: YCL2018
reviews.title: Work Hard for the A Range
reviews.comment_content: There are 2 case studies in total which are often reused throughout different semesters. This includes: West Indies Yacht Club and Kitchen Best Appliances (you can google these to read it before hand). The content itself is not hard as the Ms. Ng doesn't place too much emphasize on you have a creative solution for each case study as there are only a limited number of solutions. Hence, it will be more important to focus on the presentation skills in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ms. Ng is a pretty good teach as she is willing to answer questions and provide feedback to students if they request so. While the class may be boring at times, it is not the instructor's problem as the course content itself is not that interesting and Ms. Ng is often able to make the most out of it.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 4 main assignments under 2 case studies in the course. There are 2 presentations and 2 written report. Each of which will be related to one of the case studies.

Overall, Ms. Ng will provide the needed material for you to succeed in the class, so it is up to you if you use it and score a high grade. For example, under the written reports, one of the assessed criteria is organization. As long as you follow the report sample, there should be no problem in scoring full score in that criteria.

On the other hand, for presentations, it will be very hard to see drastic increase between your first presentation and your second presentation as it is very much based on your fluency in English. In order to score high, you must ensure you are fluent in English before taking the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is basically the 4 given assignments under the two case studies. Most student would cram it before the day it is due but if time is managed well, it shouldn't be a big problem. Also, all the presentations are group assignments so make sure you have a good group or else your presentation assignment grade will suffer.

Plus side - no finals!

reviews.author: monmon
reviews.title: Instructor
reviews.comment_content: For content, it is pretty much about professional report writing and presentations. Most of the lesson time will be spent on going through the cases and teaching us how to write good reports and do well in presentations. The content is pretty straightforward but being a good English speaker definitely helps.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ivan is really chilled out guy. He creates an extremely fun atmosphere which makes you want to engage more in classes. He likes sharing his experiences and listening to ours as well. Even though I had a 9am with him, I was pretty attentive in class. He gives pretty useful tips on business presentations which will not only be useful in the course but also with work. He spends time in class analyzing the case with us to make sure we are on the right track. He is also responds to emails and is always open to answering questions and giving us advice to improve.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say grading is okay. But focus on report writing as it weighs more.

No script is allowed during presentation so you need to be familiar with the content. If you have no other deadlines and no free riders, the workload is pretty light.

reviews.author: Andrew.cyk
reviews.title: Relatively stress-free course provided that you're competent at English
reviews.comment_content:
The two cases that were covered this semester were:
1. West Indies Yacht Club Resort: When Cultures Collide
2. Kitchen Best: Ethics when Doing Cross-boundary Business in Southern China

The first case was mainly about the analysis of the differences of work culture between two regions, the U.S. and the Caribbean. The second one was essentially about ethics of doing business in China, and how to tackle the issue of corruption in China.

While I hadn't gone through the pre-requisite courses, I was under the impression that it builds upon what you have learned in your previous LANG classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: My instructor, William was honestly a really good one. While the presentation material was mostly common sense (eg. how to give a good presentation, how to write a good report), he managed to keep the class engaged. I appreciated how he made an effort to remember everyone's name by heart.
reviews.comment_grading:
My first presentation was garbage, I screwed up the introduction and it still makes me cringe to this day. Luckily, William was quite liniment and I ended up scoring "Satisfactory" in most of the grading criteria.

My first report was apparently decent. He didn't really write anything and gave me "Excellent" for everything.

I unfortunately did not receive any feedback for the second set of presentations and reports, but I'd like to think that I did quite well.

Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
There's not much workload. There are no exams, no quizzes, just two presentations and reports to prepare for. Attendance is taken but I'm unsure to what extent that affects your overall grade.

William will babysit you through the preparation of your first presentation, just take ample notes of what he says and you'll be fine. I'm not kidding, he analyzes the case for you, your job is to elaborate on what he says.

reviews.author: wai_jai
reviews.comment_content:
Whole course mainly focus on two case studies:
Case 1:
West Indies Yacht Club Resort
(cultural difference and motivation problem within a workplace)

Case 2.
Kitchen Best
(unethical business practices in a family-running business)
reviews.comment_teaching: Kathy relies heavily on the teaching material prepared by the language center. During her lessons, she always asked to think of some underlying causes of the issues and ways of approaches to solve the case issue. The whole process is quite easy just to discuss with your group mates all the time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite good.
1st present: 6557 (23/28) 20%
1st report: 655 (16/21) 20%
2nd present: 6666 (24/28) 25%
2nd report: not released 25%
Participation: 5%
Peer Evaluation: 5%
(Kathy doesn't like people missing the lesson.)

Overall: A-

I think those who got A and A+ need get many 7 in their work.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is a little heavy.
2 reports and 2 presents regarding 2 cases during the whole semester. But the date between them are quite close.

1st present: Mid-Oct
1st report: Late-Oct
2nd present: Mid-Nov
2nd report: Late-Nov

reviews.author: readytoquit
reviews.comment_content: 2 case study
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite vague for the direction given by the instructor

First, the instructor will give you a ppt for some key points in the case study in every lesson, after that, you have the rest of the time to discuss the case with your groupmates.  The instructor will go into your breakout room to check your group's progress and give some advice on how to meet his target. However, the advice he gave just too vague. We didn't know how can we meet his target even we have his advice.
reviews.comment_grading: bad grading
reviews.comment_workload: affordable

reviews.author: 大帥哥狄奇
reviews.comment_content: the course is all about business case analysis. in Levi's lecture, we interact with our groupmates and come up with solutions repetitively for different cases. it is quite fun and satisfying that your effort pay.
reviews.comment_teaching: the teaching style of Levi is quite interesting, that he always tell jokes and interact with all of us. also, there are some group discussion time and Levi will give advice which is really useful for our presentation skill and our content. he guides us to think and brainstorm in a funny way
reviews.comment_grading: Poor. I got C range in this course even I worked very hard overnight but the group performance matters a lot and one of my groupmate screwed it up. Levi is a killer.
reviews.comment_workload: it's all about group case analysis so you have to put effort in preparing the case and the presentation in groups. it takes quite a lot of time to discuss with your groupmates but it is actually a fun process

reviews.author: -v-
reviews.title: Use common sense and do not overthink
reviews.comment_content:
The course mainly covers 2 business cases regarding culture and ethics. Do not expect technical cases in LABU and just try to understand the case and deliver the tasks with COMMON SENSE. Over-thinking will make you suffer!

DO NOT try to apply 100% of what you learn from case competition outside. It is not the same thing. Understand the context of the cases and most importantly, the expectation of your tutor!
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is more of a high-school style of teaching. Her lessons are engaging and interactive.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of Doreen is reasonable. Honestly, the grading might not be proportionate with your effort spent. You have to work smart and understand the expectation of your tutor and the deliverables. Apparently, it is impossible to have OBJECTIVE judging criteria so you must work with agility.

Case 1 presentation
6,7,6,6.5
Case 1 business proposal
7,7,7
Case 2 presentation
7,7,7,7

Final Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: For people who are good with presentation and writing proposals, the workload is pretty light as Doreen will walk you through most of the key points (i.e. problem identification, possible recommendations etc.). However, if you are not used to presentation, you might need to practice more and learn from good public speaking online. Attending lessons won't guarantee you an A!

reviews.author: Jasa
reviews.title: Poor Teaching, Average Grade
reviews.comment_content: Same as others.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor teaching. He skipped two mini-cases and ended his classes ahead of schedule. You might be happy about this, but in fact, you learn nothing.

He is also too fresh to teach, standing no comparison to other tutors like Nora and Sampson who taught for 10y+.

The most unsatisfying thing is that he gave shit comments in the consultation session - "I cannot comment on your content, I can only comment on your PowerPoint or organization". He also gave shit reviews on your performance in cases 1 & 2 - Something very general like "You should practice your intonation", END.
reviews.comment_grading:
Landed A- with most 6.
I heard my classmates (who I think are good) receive average grades too.

Why average? Another instructor, Nora, gave a lot of A range (c.50%) in her classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Due to his laisse-faire teaching style, the workload should be lower than other sessions.

Nonetheless, you are stuck in the class the whole semester for participation. So if a slightly greater workload translates to a better grade, it is worth it. Therefore, look for better tutors like Nora and Sampson.

reviews.author: Hero
reviews.title: Great course
reviews.comment_content: Case analysis and presentations, quite easy, where it equipsstudents with persuasive communication skills, both oral and written, through analyzing business cases and presenting solutions to problems identified. It provides students with a solid framework and hands-on practice to communicate persuasively and professionally in business settings. In presenting case problems, analysis and recommendations, students learn to identify issues, develop and organize key ideas, and eventually to persuade the audience of the validity of the arguments and proposed actions. The course sharpens students’ ability to explain and support ideas logically, coherently and cohesively using various techniques, to communicate clearly, concisely and accurately, and in appropriate tone and style. Through a range of learning activities involving reading, discussion, writing and making oral presentations, students also develop critical reading, critical thinking and problem solving skills as well as teamwork and leadership skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Interactive learning curve, just chat more with your professor and you will get a good grade
reviews.comment_grading: This course actually help pull my grade up, I took this course and LABU 2060 at the same time in 1 semester, score A range for both course.
reviews.comment_workload: little workload, just write 2 essay, and do 2 presentation
